title: Love this app!
body: I never gave a crap about my diabetes until I lost both of my parents at the age of 51. They both were diabetic and although that wasn‚Äôt necessarily the cause of their death as my dad had cancer and my mom had an upper GI bleed along with other issues it certainly did not help. My A1C was out of control at 10.2! Here I was downing mountain dews and never checking my sugar eating whatever I wanted. I gave up sodas, and fast food but finally have started checking my sugar as well. My endocrinologist has requested that I check my sugar randomly throughout the day and keep a record... well it has finally happened because of this app! üíï

title: Ads make it worthless
body: The app has a lot of decent features. The interface is cluttered to the point it‚Äôs hard to use and hard to find things. The reporting aspect of the app is poorly done, and that‚Äôs the most important part. In the free version, the ads after a day become so obnoxious that it‚Äôs fundamentally unusable. Full screen ads with the volume forced to 100% that offends everyone in the room. If you purchase this app you are funding a company that cares about monetizing the app far more than providing a good user experience. A premium subscription is VERY expensive, and honestly provides only a few real benefits, outside of removing the ads. I will look at EVERY alternative in the App Store before I feed this marketing tactic. There is a ‚Äúplus‚Äù version with a one time app purchase that likely removes some ads, but there is no clear statement of any difference so the only way to know is to buy it and find out. If you read enough review responses, you will learn if you buy that version you simply get another nagging form of encouragement to buy the expensive subscription. What this app provides is worth no where close to what the premium version provides.

title: This app was great
body: I loved this app before they changed to the subscription model a few months back. There are so many things you used to be able to do that aren‚Äôt available, even small things like using a custom label instead of before/after a meal. And now in order to share your graphs with your doctor you can only go back two weeks and you have to print it out vs email it. It‚Äôs a real shame not to be able to afford an app that used to be an asset to my medical care. I would have been able to use this app had there been a one time purchase price, but I can‚Äôt justify adding another monthly automatic charge just to log my glucose levels. I used to hype this app to everyone I knew with diabetes. Even my doctor was impressed, although I had to explain what happened when I could no longer send her my full detailed data via the health portal. Now I tell everyone about the app, explain how the developers forced a subscription model on users, and use it as an example of how patients suffer when profiting from their diseases becomes the goal. I wish I had never trusted this developer with my data. Now it‚Äôs locked away and I had to start over again with another app.

title: Not easy to use, weird ad blocking screen
body: I‚Äôm not sure how this has gotten such good reviews!  From the very beginning, there was a lot of pressure to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äú, with even a warning of it this will be the ‚Äúonly time‚Äù I can upgrade, with a full screen countdown clock?  10,9,8...what?  Of course I said no, and it ends up that the features they were trying to get me to pay for, are already on the app such as your A-1 C average level?  I wanted to enter previous data from the last month but that became too difficult in this app.  When you are entering the information, they have a tag that you can say before breakfast or before lunch etc.  but then they don‚Äôt have a separate area to add food.  Even though I might be entering my fasting blood sugar level, they make you add the food on that page?  So in that entry you have to look hard to understand that I ate that breakfast AFTER I took my level.   Also after entering about four numbers, this ad began to block the view and then when you click the X to close it,  it would open it.  That happened a few times, and I quickly deleted the app!!! Never had anything like this on an app!

title: I Used To Love This App
body: I have used Glucose Buddy for several years and loved it!  It was so helpful to me, that I shared it with my diabetic health care team, in hopes they could let other patients no how it helped me.   That is no longer the case!  Version 5 of Glucose Buddy was released during the fall of 2017 and the App (in my opinion) was ruined.  First,  the data entry screen no longer fits on the screen of my mobile device.  Some of the selections are barely visible.  Second are the incessant and annoying pop-up ads that make viewing the App‚Äôs screens very difficult.  Finally are the high pressure ads to subscribe to the premium version of Glucose Buddy for a fee of $60 per year.   Many of the most helpful features of Glucose Buddy are only available with a premium subscription, which I‚Äôm unwilling to pay.   If you ignore the reviews of the pre-version 5 Glucose Buddy you can see the ratings drop from 4 & 5 stars to 1, 2 & 3 stars.  (check for your self)

title: GB Improvements
body: Great App, simple and easy to use, great way to keep track of blood sugar readings in an easily understandably format.  Plus can email results directly to Dr, cutting down on time consuming expensive visits.  Only two things keeps it from a Five Star Rating, wish would add capability for two separate accounts, so could keep track of my wife's readings all in one App, and it's a small nitpicking thing, wish you would add another "Fasting" category with it's own color.  My Dr is mainly interested in my "Fasting" readings, and I can only list "Out of Bed" or "Before Breakfast", which show up with the same colors as "Other" or "Before Meals", causing some confusion and time consuming research to separate them.   Add those capabilities, and you've really got a winner.

title: OK but user interface is terrible
body: The app is great overall. They use a data collection strategy to get users hooked on the practicality of the product. Then when you try to use advanced features or download the data you entered, you have to pay for it. So I guess that works pretty well for them...

title: One Stop Shopping, Kinda
body: 2 days in and great app so far. I‚Äôm a visual person so graphs and images resonate and sometimes inspire me.

title: Still Ads and No Support
body: Not even counting the limitations on adding meals. Paid for ad free version to use, one year. Constantly get a pop up asking me if I want to purchase the app for a discount for a limited time that then disappears shortly after. Trying to add A1C to average, but apparently there is no support. When I try to access support from app it asks me to try something else for free it takes me to a sales force site where I can pay for something? Did they mess up a plug in for their app and it‚Äôs for their company or what happened? Try to access support from App Store and it takes me to a site saying it‚Äôs not found. Going to find alternative and cancel subscription.

title: Difficult to receive support
body: I was initially excited to have this app because it seemed to have it all! Exercise log, data sync, nutrition, weight management, etc. I was most excited to have the ability to sync my Dexcom! I made the premium purchase and.... have yet to have my Dexcom sync. I have tried several times and nothing each time. I attempted to find support for this issue. Stuff happens right? I attempted to get support through the app and revive an error via that way and then tried via the website and am prompted to purchase or have two weeks free of another application in order to receive support for it. I have tried several times to receive support and I have not been able to do so. It has rendered the application and premium purchase completely useless to me.

title: There is a Big Difference Between Paying for Something of that is Well Made & Being Extorted
body: I couldn‚Äôt agree with MommaHippi more.  This app used to be something special. Something I would have paid for because it was worth it back then. But I wasn‚Äôt asked. I wasn‚Äôt warned. The app was just suddenly changed, and I discovered that if I wanted my information I would be charged a substantially large fee for it.  I‚Äôve given the new app a chance, but find myself becoming upset when I try to use it.  Now it‚Äôs just like all the other apps that do the same thing - but the interface is ugly and confusing.   Developers do this to themselves and their customers a lot these days. It must be profitable. I‚Äôm going back to paper and pencil.

title: Simple and well worth it
body: I have never written a review before for an app.   I held out on paying for the upgraded price because $ you know, but it got a bit hard using multiple free apps to track health things. I tried several extensively and while others may look more fun, this app does what I need it to do.   It‚Äôs very easy using the app to track the things I need.    If I want to track more things it has the capability.   I can track less if I want.   I don‚Äôt like having to track but this app makes it easier.

title: Great app ‚Äî no bugs
body: I‚Äôve been using the app for over a year and haven‚Äôt had any major issues with it. It‚Äôs stable and helpful. I do wish it provided more analytical data capability, but it is good for tracking carbs it even recognizes food when you take a picture. It has recognized every barcoded item I‚Äôve tried and lets you reuse items you‚Äôve already scanned and even input your own recipes. It can always use more enhancements like the data analyzing capability I mentioned and a better recipe building capability and salad or sandwich building capability.

title: Feedback Review because Support Page ‚ÄúNot Found‚Äù through link
body: 1. My steps do not sync with my watch and are off by over 1,200-1,500 everyday. The rest syncs perfectly.

title: Not happy
body: I decided to pay this high amount for the app because it seemed to have everything I was looking for, including nutrition information like how much fat etc I consumed in my day besides the food diary.

title: Find something else
body: This would be a good app.  I paid for the full version about a year ago.  They made some improvements after making some errors. But STOP trying to sell me stuff.  I paid for the app!

title: People are funny - especially me!
body: I really like this app. I loved the old insights and when it was updated I was mad. Couldn't stand the new insights. So they put the old one back because I‚Äôm guessing many others breathed fire and brimstone on the development team. Well now after reverting, I think I preferred the new interface! Maybe adding the older charting to the new interface as an extra would resolve many issues. I wonder how many people actually experienced this change. Anyway. Thumbs up to the development team.

title: Glucose Buddy has made a difference in my life.
body: Over the last two years, I have been using the FreeStyle LibraLink sensor to check my blood sugar. I knew my blood sugar was out of control but did not know how to manage it.  In February 2021, I discovered Glucose Buddy. This program has made a huge difference for me.  When I started using it my A1 C was 6.6. It is now 6.3. Other benefits are  that I have lost weight and my meds have been reduced. ..all from using Glucose Buddy.  Overall, I feel so much better.  Using this program is easy.   It is life changing.

title: LOVE this App!
body: We recently went back to injections after being on a pump for 7 years. I had forgotten how much info there is to keep track of when you‚Äôre doing it without technology! We tried a different app and hated it. Love this one because of the reports, they help me see trends without having to use a CGM, that I can add all her different meds and track her glucose, carb intake, activity and insulin usage. The only thing that could possibly make this better would be if I could enter her ratios for figuring her insulin and correction factor.

title: Great App!!!
body: I started using this app in February 2019. My A1C at the time was 8.6 and my proteins were over 600. I started tracking everything with this app and A1C is 6.8, protein is at 30, and I have lost 30 pounds. I went from 55 units of insulin to 30. Saw my Dr yesterday and she said drop to 25 units. When I go to the Dr. she can see all me glucose readings for the month. I love that with a few clicks she can see blood pressure readings, steps, or anything else this app tracks. I recommend this app to everyone I meet with diabetes. It was well worth the money!!

title: Love Glucose Buddy!
body: For now, I am only using the glucose recording function of this app because I use another app that tracks everything else.  I love that it keeps track of my averages for me. It keeps me in line better when I not only have to test my blood sugar, but then I have to enter it into glucose buddy ‚Äì ‚Äì makes it more realistic than just looking at the number on my meter and turning it off.  I highly recommend getting this app.

title: More than I need or want
body: I‚Äôve used this app for quite awhile. It had a straightforward interface and feature set. The recent major upgrade of this app brought with it a lot of additional features, a major overhaul of the UI and sharing functionalities. All I need is an app that lets me record my blood glucose. I can‚Äôt imagine why I would ever share that with anyone! I don‚Äôt find the new overcomplicated UI to be an improvement either. The continued pop-ups asked how I like the app are really annoying, as are the overemphasized messages complaining that I don‚Äôt have location or sharing enabled. So, I‚Äôve switched to an app that is simple and uncluttered with a swollen feature set. Sorry this app got so ‚Äúimproved‚Äù.

title: Not a useful app for the high price
body: Expensive subscription. Must pay to see what the app really offers. Why pay if I don‚Äôt know what I am paying for? What I see in the free app sure isn‚Äôt encouraging.

title: Very handy app :)
body: I do actually love this app. Makes it easy to remember and store blood sugars and spot trends in highs and lows.

title: Best app for diabetics! (Updated)
body: Update: 3/6/21

title: Pricey Subscription for Features that Lock Up
body: Overall, this app is crucial to me for tracking foods and blood glucose. The issues, though are frustrating. I find the app locking up in various features. I chose to pay for the monthly subscription so that I could utilize more tools that would benefit me most (more recipes instead of maximum of 5, quick add foods, filter searching). I am disappointed by the number of bugs that freeze the app, namely attempting to filter my Log to only display Blood Glucose. Considering I paid specifically hoping to use that feature, I would like to be able to use it!!!

title: Confusing interface
body: The app really pushes upgrading to premium, to the max! I tried it but deleted it after struggling inputting information and then looking for food information. The records are not completely editable. There is no way to select food types and get your nutritional information. It says take a photo. Are you kidding me? I know what I ate! The app pushes a lot of costly educational materials. If I was new to diabetes I would be sucked in. But I am not. Just need a simple application to track sugar, meds, and meals in a understandable less then 100 page report for my doctor. What doctor has time to look at a huge daily report that it generates? To much useless add-ones. Deleted it after trying it two times.

title: Glitch
body: I have my ReliOn Premium BLU meter linked to my app. The time settings are correct in the app and on my iPhone, yet when ever I take a reading, it transmits via Bluetooth with a time stamp 6 hours earlier than the actual time. I have to manually correct the time for every reading I take. Very frustrating. When I tried to report the issue on the app an error pops up saying that it can‚Äôt send emails and to check my settings. So I am having a hard time getting any support. Does anyone know of another app that I can link my meter to and also record daily medication and things like weight, diet?  I‚Äôm open to suggestions. Thanks.

title: Better than My Plate
body: I understand that the Live Strong My Plate app has a different purpose and it served me well. I lost 70 pounds using it. But it does little to nothing to aid with diabetes control. I like how GB works, for the most part. I am educating myself other ways too, but I consider the app a must have. I bought the upgrade and am a few meals away from a report. I‚Äôd like to see a community or user group section for support. That and some other minor things prevent a five star rating. I give it a 4.1.

title: Lacks information
body: I really want to use this app for the information that I want to keep track of, but the time of recording is wrong most of the time. I purchased a years subscription and not sure that the subscription is worth it.

title: Dislike the update!
body: The old version was simple, I loved it. The newest update is totally different and now I'm looking for a new app in which to log my daily glucose levels. I don't want all the "extras" plus for some reason I'm unable to receive log reports sent to any of my email accounts. I agree with every other negative review regarding the recent update. This went from a 5 star to a 1 star overnight.

title: Glucose tracking
body: I‚Äôm 70 years old and pre-diabetic

title: Disappointed as well
body: I too was a fan of the previous version of this app. Screen design aside, I feel uneasy storing all my medical information in their cloud (if Experion can be hacked, their cloud would be child‚Äôs play) ! I see no reason readings can‚Äôt be stored locally and reported from there.

title: Awesome App
body: A loved ones A1C was out of control so I loaded this app on his phone as a device for him to track his carbs but this app is so much more. He can log his activity and it tells him his caloric intake and output. With subscription it tracks his A1C levels which is what we need in this critical time. This app keeps it organized-all in one app. I joined as support to cheer him on and can see his progress as a friend. I highly recommend. Great motivational tool.

title: Pretty good app but it has its problems
body: After using the app for a few months I have enjoyed all it can do but after reading the reviews of what they app could do compared to what it cannot do now is a big change.

title: Apple Watch not compatible :‚Äô(
body: I have just one want from this awesome app, is if I can also log my glucose numbers on my Apple Watch.

title: App has problems
body: I‚Äôm in my second year as a premium subscriber. At some point I lost access to the premium functions. It still shows I‚Äôm subscribed but I can‚Äôt do reports or see my a1c estimate. Contacting customer support is not easy as I‚Äôve been met with links going to non-existent pages or customer contact pages that don‚Äôt work.

title: Mostly good, but a very annoying ‚Äúfeature‚Äù
body: Every couple of days, it asks if is use the same dosage every time for my insulin. Every time I say ‚Äúno‚Äù. It doesn‚Äôt ever remember and asks again. I change my dosage depending on my blood sugar, and while I sometimes have 2 or 3 days of the same, it is not an all the time the same thing. If it were, I would not need an ap to track it!

title: I'm a fan.
body: Been using Glucose Buddy for several years now. I'm Type 2 and was pushing 250 lbs. I'm under control now and down 30 pounds. Seeing my numbers over time and trending makes a difference. The graphs, timeline and printing out for my doctors are the features I like best. Yes, I have tried others before finding Glucose Buddy. They discouraged me and actually delayed my progress. Glucose Buddy has become My Buddy.

title: Wonder why?
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for quite some time. Every aspect of my glucose levels (and beyond) are handled near perfectly. My only disappointment is with these two Azumio apps, Glucose Buddy and Argus. They each display multiple read outs on my weight. Instead of listing my weight once as expected, it will show it 3-4 times on every day readings are taken. I‚Äôve reported it via the App Store, but no remedy after many months. I wonder why?

title: From Great to No Way
body: I have used Glucose Buddy for many years. It's been a real asset in maintaining blood glucose control. I even appreciated the recent upgrade. From a functional standpoint, GB is a hit.

title: Sorry, but it does too much.
body: I‚Äôm leaving Glucose Buddy because it has become a hovering nanny that needs to be paid to leave me alone to simply record my blood sugar. I brought my levels down for two years, but an illness and steroids shot it back up. I need to track for at least a month - just glucose, not food, exercise, contact friends, post on social media - and this hovering/selfie-ad infested app just doesn‚Äôt do it. If a nanny is needed, this app will fill the bill and for just a few dollars a month all the things I don‚Äôt need/want are available.

title: GB
body: The only downside to this app is that the suggested A1c was 10 points off what my actual A1c was, unless you are constantly monitoring it, it‚Äôs not going to be accurate  so I‚Äôd recommend that be removed. Otherwise this app makes it easy to track , I use 2 different meters so this pulls it all into one spot. Like that you can add pictures and notes

title: First time user
body: Was looking for an app that would track my carbs and my glucose. Was excited to find this one. Unfortunately it won‚Äôt work unless I want to pay. I‚Äôve searched several items I had at meals today and did not locate them. Yes I could add them, but only the name and calories....if I wanted to add the other info I‚Äôd need to upgrade to premium.  I guess I‚Äôll just have to stay with the 2 free apps I use right now to track food in one and glucose in the other.

title: Premium version still includes ads
body: I would have given this app 5 stars if it only tracked my numbers. But it constantly nags you to add additional services to your account, and continues to throw ads in your face. I‚Äôve used the app for the past 3 years and I‚Äôm getting more and more annoyed with it. I don‚Äôt remember exactly what it costs, something like $30 per year. But for that kind of money, you would think that you would receive an ad free version. Today it wanted to sell me a scale.

title: Works well!
body: I really like Glucose Buddy, I paid the $40 for the annual membership and it‚Äôs worth it. I don‚Äôt know where people are getting $40 a month. I didn‚Äôt pay for the coaching or nutrition plan.

title: Nice find
body: I work in healthcare and was a little surprised that my provider wanted me to start taking blood glucose readings but had no tools to capture this for my chart.

title: Almost there
body: I used the program be for I purchased the premium versions. Price and features almost caused me to abandon this series. It is very pricey but the premium features are good. It is a complete program and record keeper. There needs to be a better free version and the pricing structure versus features/functions ratio. However it is still one of the most complete system on the market, but more interoperability people be nice.

title: Great, But Not Fully Compatible with Apple Health
body: Since I‚Äôve been diagnosed with diabetes type 1, I‚Äôve been looking for an app to input all my related medical data. Glucose Buddy have been the best one I‚Äôve found and used so far.

title: Great App
body: Really great app.  I especially like the visual feed back on blood sugar levels.

title: High Pressure Sales to buy premium
body: From the very second I logged into this for the first time the application became nothing but pressure sales to get me to buy their premium login ‚Äúthe premium version‚Äù. There was even a 22nd last chance pitch to get me to upgrade to the premium for ever even let me onto the application. I deleted the app when the 20 second countdown was done. If that‚Äôs the way they greet the customers then i don't want to be one of the customers

title: New change
body: Since the new update I no longer use this app as much as I used to.  You can no longer see your logs displayed in such a way as to easily view or compare them like before. Adding an entry is no longer an easy task and there are now more steps to go through in order to log or find logs. I like the new look but I prefer something that works well regardless of how esthetically pleasing it is. I do wish they would change that part back.

title: Time to say goodbye
body: Not a fan of the this updated version with the new company. Prior to this it was very easy to filter results and at one point I was even able to add a custom tag. Now one has to upgrade to the premium version to filter results! Seriously?!!!? The ability to apply a filter to my results should be a basic feature especially with the new look.  It‚Äôs not user friendly to be able to find your results. Bye, bye old friend. Time to find a new app.

title: Trying to delete
body: Had high hopes when I downloaded this app. After wading through the tedious process of entering my data, I couldn‚Äôt get past the incessant pop ups to upgrade. I click on the ‚ÄòX‚Äô to hide the ad and it took me to the upgrade page EVERY TIME. I‚Äôve spent the last 15 minutes trying to find an email address to request they delete my info since I have deleted their app. Still cannot find an address. If I start getting email junk to buy or try glucose monitoring items, I‚Äôll know where it started. Ugh!!!!!!!!

title: Great App!
body: I was looking for a new Diabetes App, as the In Check Diabetes App which I was using is being discontinued.  I found great reviews about Glucose Buddy.  I decided to try it out.  I have been using it for a week and absolutely love the ease of the App!  It has proven better than what I was using and more features to it.  Definitely recommend Glucose Buddy!!!

title: I like this app.
body: It‚Äôs easy to use and carry my glucose readings to my doctor appointments. I also like the estimated A1C. It helps keep me on track with my carb intake.

title: Essential App
body: Been using the app for many years to track my glucose readings. Don‚Äôt use most of tge other features as only use insulin once daily. Like the estimated A1c calculation. It has tracked closely with testing. Good integration with the Health App. I don‚Äôt like the subscription model, but like the no ads, and realize the developer must eat. Keep up the support.

title: Always trying to push or trick you into buying things.
body: This used to be a good app and then they changed and now keep hitting you constantly with offers for upgrades and more paying services, some of which you can‚Äôt avoid.  Once you‚Äôve logged in a bunch of readings, you can‚Äôt download or print out report for your doctor unless you pay.  If you don‚Äôt pay, then you have to write down your readings to provide to doctor.  I‚Äôm leaving to find an app that doesn‚Äôt lock your information down unless you pay money.

title: Disappointed
body: So I download Glucose Buddy (free) and start setting up. In settings I sync, or try to, the Health data and the app never, recovers. I see it spinning next to the network icon. Close the app and reopen, no response from the app. Delete the app. Buy the $1.99 app and try the same thing. Sync Health and the app freezes. It‚Äôs only $2 bucks but come on, really. Your app does not work and won‚Äôt come out of the sync spin. Then the app blows up. I tried to use the contact from the Glucose Buddy site but that doesn‚Äôt work either. Disappointed.

title: Almost but not yet
body: I first looked at the app some years ago and chose to not set it up.  Now I have returned and setup an account.  I do not want to pay $40 or more for a Premium. I do not care for the incessant push to subscribe.  I‚Äôll probably look for an alternative if this pushing continues.  It‚Äôs distracting, interrupting, and very annoying.  You asked, I said no but it persists.  I know such premium accounts end up being more and more opportunities to shell out payments for more and more.

title: I‚Äôm out of here, AMF.
body: Like many others that have provided reviews of this app, I‚Äôve been a long time user. The new app claimed to be newer, better, easier. It‚Äôs not.

title: Was a Great App!
body: Easy to use. Love the graph! I can print out my logs to take to the doctor with me.

title: Disappointed
body: I‚Äôll a brand new user to this aspect of using technology in my health care. I have read disappointed99‚Äôs review and have to agree completely! This may of been a great app,but,

title: Sales dominates home screen
body: Hi, I was recently diagnosed diabetic and turned to your app to help me count carbs and log my glucose levels.  Unfortunately you are eating up too much of the screen with your sales banner that I get frustrated every time I try to enter info or get a good look at my daily food and glucose entries.  I am trying other apps but truly hope you rethink just how much screen real estate you are chewing up..I know I am not alone in my opinion...check your recent ratings!

title: Almost there
body: Liked this app enough to subscribe for a year. Many features I do like.

title: Really!
body: When I take the time to write a review, then something has effected me! This is a great app! I use it exclusively. I only thing I‚Äôm disappointed about is the latest update that changed to way information is entered. No happy about it, but it WON‚ÄôT deter me from using this wonderful app. I give it a 4.8.

title: Login? No thanks.
body: Why do I need to login or setup an account to use the app? Nope nope nope. Never going to allow any health related app make me ‚Äúcreate an account‚Äù. This app is even worse: doesn‚Äôt even tell you WHY you need to create an account. Just wants you to set it up before you can even see what‚Äôs inside. Deleted.

title: Not Getting Better
body: I have used this app for several years even paying extra for the deluxe version.  I‚Äôve lost track of the many updates, but a few years ago an update cancelled my ‚Äúdeluxe‚Äù status so now I get constant notifications to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù to the latest deluxe version.

title: Sorry
body: I wish to god I would have used this app for a bit before purchasing the yearly subscription. Biggest problem is when you scan a food it shows everything there. When you go to insights and pull it up all line items are zeroed our. Then if you switch the serving it goes completely whacko. For example it listed something that should be 140 calories as 14,000 calories. The only way I can make it get even close to accurate is if I switch serving size to between .04 and .05.

title: Money hungry
body: I didn‚Äôt even finish setting up the app to get started. The app kept asking... well more like insisting, that I subscribe. Apparently the programmer(s) don‚Äôt have enough confidence in their app to inspire people to want the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù so they feel the need to brow beat you into upgrading prior to even using it. If they don‚Äôt have confidence in it, why should I? I deleted it.  For the other programmers out there, don‚Äôt nag potential customers. Let them try your app. If they like it and see the benefit of upgrading, they‚Äôll do so.

title: Upgrade to premium
body: Upgraded to premium yesterday via App Store and not able to get any of the new features.....still ads, no a1c, graphs, not able to generate reports.... I have not heard back from support... if you are going to charge 59+ dollars, should have been better tested.

title: Live with this app!
body: My husband and I have used this app for years. It‚Äôs so convenient and easy to use. My doctor loves it too. All he has to do is look on our phones to monitor our blood glucose history. It on takes seconds to record your numbers and you‚Äôre done!

title: Journal bp and glucose
body: This has been great as an overall logging journal for my glucose and bp. I‚Äôve been able to show my dr my glucose and bp trends. Every now and again I can add in my weight. I wish the food thing had more already put in items - not brands - just items. Maybe it does, I just haven‚Äôt found it or it wasn‚Äôt evident. So basically haven‚Äôt had any directions and I just use it to log.

title: Love this app.
body: I've told everyone I know about this app. I was so overwhelmed when I was diagnosed with diabetes. After a couple of weeks of trying to figure things out manually, I discovered Glucose Buddy. I can't imagine tracking my diabetes without it now. Been using it for 3 1/2 months.

title: Good app!
body: I love this app, it has helped me see what I‚Äôm doing wrong as well as what I‚Äôm doing right. I‚Äôve learned to portion my meals, average out my blood sugar and pressure and share everything with my doctor. This app is well worth it! Though I hate it wouldn‚Äôt let me use my name to send a comment though!

title: Good for me.
body: Glucose buddy works good for me. I do have an issue when trying to put in two slices of bread or two eggs, sometimes it will glitch and I have to go out. And then end up putting the bread in twice in the eggs in twice. Not a big deal, but a glitch in the program. I love the ability to scan barcodes. Best way to input data.

title: App not working
body: I have been using this app for a while and it‚Äôs been great. I decided to upgrade so I could all the features. Once the trial was over and they received the payment for the year it stopped working I can‚Äôt get it to open. I click the app help and it says page not found. So disappointed.

title: Old version
body: Is there any way to use the previous version? I liked being able to put glucose level and medicine in one screen without having to switch between items

title: Way too nosy
body: I used to use this app and it was simple and met my need, which was to track my glucose level.  Now it is way too aggressive about wanting you to buy the premium version and to connect you to other apps ( like Apple health).  They want direct access to your glucometer. And they want to know your weight, diet, etc.  Basically, they want to get your money and then sell as much information about you as possible.  No, thanks.  I think I‚Äôll just buy some graph paper.

title: Shameless advertising and warped Apple rating system
body: When companies focus more on annoying me into buying their product instead of providing value to me, I go elsewhere.

title: Great Help
body: The app has been such a great help to me in my daily life with diabetes type II.  Now I have a way to track my blood sugars throughout the day and get periodic reports that help me to check how I‚Äôm doing, along with my A1 C score. It‚Äôs also helpful to take to the doctors office of the doctor can see it as well.

title: Maybe I‚Äôm just old
body: Liked it better before they changed to subscription .  The app still lets me chart my glucose which is why I use it.  Don‚Äôt know why they want my location that‚Äôs not why I use the map and don‚Äôt need s drain on my battery life .

title: Recent bug (annoying)
body: It has been a great app (I am subscribed to it) but recently, an annoying bug is found where the blood glucose level entries get duplicated multiple times ‚Äî even the old entries that used to be (obviously) a single entry.  Please fix this bug as soon as possible. Thanks.

title: Needs Recipe Entry
body: This would be an complete package app for diabetes if it didn‚Äôt just use AI food tracking but also allowed for recipe storage like MyFitnessPal and other health apps so I can have the most accurate log of what I am consuming by indicating how many servings I‚Äôm having of that meal. This app isn‚Äôt truly complete without that capability. I‚Äôm better off just using my Dexcom and MyFitness Pal at this point. Please consider adding this feature.

title: Love love love!!
body: This app has really helped me lose weight and get my diabetes under control! I have lost 37 lbs!! I am constantly checking to make sure I get as many steps in as I can. Plus, the link to LifeCoin is huge! I also found sweatcoin. I am using all of them!! It‚Äôs great!! Thank you!

title: Super easy!!!
body: I was diagnosed last year with Type 2 diabetes and this app has helped me get and keep my BG levels in check!!! Love the fact that it has the ability to help you track your diet and other changes. Amazing app, glad I‚Äôve got it, it‚Äôs a much needed help!!!

title: App Keeps Crashing
body: I used this app years ago and went back to it as I need to start tracking my blood sugar again. I was able to use this app for the past 48 hours. I logged my blood sugar this morning and now I cannot open the app. It keeps crashing. I tried reinstalling the app but that hasn‚Äôt helped. Thanks god the app info backed up to the website. I‚Äôll have to switch to another app now to keep tracking. I‚Äôm disappointed as I like a lot of the features of this app.

title: Just a money grab
body: I was going to try this ‚Äúfree‚Äù app to see if it meets my needs, but it wouldn‚Äôt actually let me use it. The first thing it does is pop up a screen asking me to pay 50 dollars. If I cancel this, it goes to an ‚Äúare you sure?‚Äù page. Cancelling this brings you back to the ‚Äúpay 50 dollars page.‚Äù There is apparently no way to use this app without forking over 50 bucks up front. I wish I could have back the 10 minutes I wasted on this thing.

title: Trouble saving medicine
body: Since the new upgrade it won‚Äôt save my medicine. Where you are supposed to enter the dosage the screen goes back to the list of medicine. It won‚Äôt stay on the screen to enter dosage and doesn‚Äôt show on my daily data.

title: Difficult to use
body: I end up with multiple photos of the same entry. When I enter Snacks it insists it is breakfast depending on the time. Won‚Äôt reflect the change. I can‚Äôt believe this gets a 4.8 rating. Support is nonexistent. People complain about being charged without agreement. The website has 10 articles to help. No tutorial. A1C is way off. GB calculates it to be 4.9 and lab testing was 5.9. Big difference whether normal or not. Requesting a refund based on function. Doesn‚Äôt work.

title: Great Ap!
body: I have been using it for 6 months. Especially like the feature that allows me to scan barcodes on foods that I can‚Äôt find in list. My doctor was impressed!  She spent a lot of time. Looking at the reports.

title: Was great...Don't like it now
body: This was a great little app that I used for a couple of years here.  Then they did a "New And Improved."   Now there's so much crap in it that it's a pain to just use to chart your readings any more.

title: Disappointed in Update!
body: This app use to be so easy to use. Now I struggle with the size and changes. Also the updated version bombards you with ads. On top of it all, it wants you to share your disease with your friends. How stupid is that. My medical problems are private and not to be public. Also, I have an Apple Watch and it doesn‚Äôt pick up the exercise I do. I will definitely change apps as soon as I find one that works well with my lifestyle.

title: Just Ok
body: Interface is a bit crowded and confusing. Reports seem buggy.  When viewed in app report doesn‚Äôt show all tags.  When report is emailed (as a link) it only shows one day of data.  The reports are what I‚Äôm most interested in.  The app has many features but it can be difficult to navigate between them.

title: Easy to use and share with doctors
body: I track my reading and all my meds. It‚Äôs easy to print reports for my doctor and I can also just show the info from my phone. I also like that it gives my average A1C.

title: Good but lacking activity sync
body: I really like this app and use it often for my diabetic patients but it does not connect with my Apple Watch or iPhone health app well enough to completely track my activity and steps. Not as many food choices as my fitness pal. I love the automatic run start on the azumio app.

title: A great way to record my intake
body: With this app I count my calories and keep track of what I ate and what I haven‚Äôt ate. It‚Äôs reassuring that I have a record of food intake. So for example I‚Äôve been looking at my record and I realize I haven‚Äôt ate spinach in a while then I make some spinach.

title: Saving medication
body: The ability to save medication doses in the last update is great except for one thing.  I no longer have access to the decimal point so my medication can‚Äôt be entered correctly. Can you please fix that?

title: Glucose Buddy review
body: Please give option to revert back to the previous Glucose Buddy tracking. After the update, mine logs entries using incorrect times. It‚Äôs now double the work. And if it logs times incorrectly, monitoring blood, taking meds, can be detrimental. Please revert back to previous. This new system is less than user friendly and is not what I paid for. I paid for the ease of use with the other version.

title: Change the update!!!!
body: I have to use another app since your app is not working - my doctor is reducing my meds because I‚Äôve been tracking my T2 diabetes using your app. I have not been able to log in the number of units of bolus and basal insulin, so I cannot track my food with my insulin. Please change the app functionality back to what it was. The UI is MUCH more difficult to figure out, especially due to the fact that it is not working.

title: Easy to use
body: App is easy to use, definitely can find information without difficulty.  Don‚Äôt like the persistent advertisement in the middle of my screen that has a X for close but when you touch the X it opens it instead.  Sorry I don‚Äôt wish to use the add-ons.

title: Mostly great, but...
body: I mostly love the way it looks and functions. If I only needed it to enter glucose results (and I never had to edit an entry) I would give it 5 stars. But dates in general seem to be an issue. When I add a meal, it doesn‚Äôt allow me to set the entry time. It appears to use the time from the last entry of the same food. But when I edit the entry it shows a completely different time.

title: Use Everyday
body: Love using this wonderful app, my doctor want me to keep track of my sugar. This app makes it easy by not having to write them down on paper. Also let that it send all my readings to my iPhone health app.

title: Great tracking tool for diabetics
body: I use this app and it‚Äôs a great way to track your health or progress. Just recently acquired this app to monitor my sugar since beginning my Ketogenic diet. It‚Äôs helped me get off my diabetes meds and monitor my course to a better health

title: Basics aren‚Äôt great
body: Too much going on in this app and the basics don‚Äôt function correctly. Each time I entered my glucose, the app would add a duplicate record. Sometimes it would be set to public instead of private. The dupe never had the timing notes attached to it, which made it easy to delete. All of the dupes I deleted eventually made their way back. Also would enter info (weight, steps) from other apps multiple times. Not recommended.

title: Crappy App
body: There are so many issues, even the premium version.

title: No longer worth the trouble.
body: Used it for years, was simple, fast, kept track of what I needed. Then it changed to the subscription mode and became too buggy. Popup ads, simple info input became hard, pressing saved button diverts to inappropriate websites. Posted numbers were changed on saved. Steps no longer saved on correct days. No longer able to sync info between devices. Looking for replacement app.

title: Making It Easy
body: Keeping track is easy with this app. I look forward to watching my progress and seeing where I make not the best food choices and how that offsets the glucose level. My dietician loves it too!

title: I am thankful for Glucose Buddy app
body: I‚Äôve used glucose buddy for years. It really has helped me track my blood sugars. I tried another app, but this is better and easier. I can get a report to give my Dr, and that has helped in my care.

title: Super Diabetes app
body: Easy to log all your information for your record and doctor report.  Helps to teach you how to  control and educate you about diabetes and teaches you how to control food intake.  Highly recommend for newbies.

title: The new glucose buddy app
body: I like the new updated glucose buddy.  Easier to use and more organized.  However, the choices in the curve (glucose, A1c, food, activity, etc) are somewhat out of the field.  They need to be closer together & within the field so that one of the choices can be selected.

title: Excellent
body: For the cost of a date night for my husband & I, this app is worth it!  I was just diagnosed and I enjoy the app features.  It keeps track of everything my doctor and dietitian needs to keep me balanced!

title: Add this feature
body: Hello

title: Poor
body: Advertises desktop access. Reality is that feature was discontinued by the "engineering staff" according to a FAQ. Premium is expensive and does not really get you anything more than basic. Their website Advertises "Enhaned Filters" which I am sure is "Enhanced Filters" but tend to not trust companies that don't spell check their websites. Premium function "Filters" gets you really nothing for the money.  Wish I could get my money back.

title: Easy to use & so helpful!
body: Wish the food database was a bit more expansive, but it is easy to look up & add the nutritional info for items not listed.  Overall, I really appreciate the help on carb counting & tracking!  Would definitely recommend!

title: A real help.
body: Glucose Buddy has really helped me bring down my A1C. You have to do the work, but act of recording your data on a regular basis, especially with the app‚Äôs ‚Äúnags‚Äù when one is remiss, makes it easier to keep on track.

title: Review
body: I have had this free app for 4+ years. This morning I went to record blood sugar and app comes up and immediately goes off. Tried update and still the same results. Very unhappy

title: Heart rate
body: Where is the heart rate function now?  Can‚Äôt find it after recent update. üò¢ this was super useful for me as I‚Äôm trying to make sure my rate reaches a certain avg while walking. Also where did the stats go? App support link has an error upon opening

title: Very Helpful - please add section geared to gestational diabetes
body: Great app very helpful at consistently tracking in one place, glucose levels, nutrition and med adherence. Please add section/differentiated goals and nutritional information for gestational diabetes. The goals and recommendations are importantly different due to needing to get enough calories and nutrition for baby.

title: Good
body: I‚Äôm doing a lot better eating the right foods. This app has a lot of good features. I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm doing it wrong but it would be nice if I could search by restaurant menu. I type Pepsi I should see all the products and I don‚Äôt Arby‚Äôs I should see the items they have.

title: Connectivity to steps from Applewatch
body: I‚Äôm new to this app, however so far so good.  I just wish the app was able to track my steps from my Apple Watch and not just the movement from my iPhone.  My activity level shows very low with out it.

title: New to diabetes
body: Very easy to use. Disappointed in the limited options without paying. Have been trying other apps and learning more options without paying; have found other apps more useful. Unsure why the app options that are most pertinent are only available for an ungodly fee. Unless fee decreases, I will be utilizing the other app.

title: This app is super buggy
body: I have reported this bug to app support but I had no reply. When I log an event, I always take a photo of my insulin pump screen for reference. Often, that photo is lost. Also, the time of the event often automatically switches to early in the morning. These bugs are super simple to fix, but the app is pretty useless until they fix them. I told the app support folks I am willing to help, yet no contact.

title: Too cluttered and expensive
body: I like the ability to include notes and tags, and the graphs are a good idea but not very useful on the free version.  The screens are so filled with ads that it‚Äôs hard to actually see much of your own data. The paid version is WAY too expensive for what you get ($14+/month?!).  I will continue looking for an alternative.

title: Very easy to use and convenient..
body: I love the fact that you can record your glucose level and also your meal intake. Must log books don‚Äôt give you this option.

title: Great now has DEXCOM interface
body: It's goo to see Glucose Buddy is keeping up with advances in diabetes management. By importing DEXCOM data it now provides a comprehensive picture of where my sugar levels are going along with a carb counter for insulin management decisions.

title: Bull Crap
body: I have had this app for a very long time and now they want to charge me to get my A1C. This is bull crap and I am searching for a new app that won‚Äôt charge me. I only need to know what my A1C is so everything else is useless to me.

title: Nice little monitor!
body: Easy to use and full of information!  I also gives me a concise and organized place to keep track of all my "vitals"!  Highly recommend!

title: Good
body: I started counting carbs more and generally tracking everything. The only issue I‚Äôve found is the search feature isn‚Äôt as good as some other apps like my fitness pal. But the picture guessing is helpful

title: Big scam! Beware
body: I was forced to subscribe for an unwanted year due to a fraudulent trick by this App operator. Even though I canceled Immediately my subscription , it was not canceled and the payment was made through my Visa Card on my Apple a/c. Support team Danica lied about have no control over the subscription when she did refund me days later to cancel and she did!. This app is designed so that it is not possible to cancel the subscription on

title: Glucose Buddy
body: Works great for me!  I‚Äôve been tracking with GB for 4 months now & doing very well.  It‚Äôs easy to use, has great features.  I export my data to Excel & report that way.  My Dr likes the reporting.  All works very well for me.

title: Good news for tracking numbers
body: I like being able to see both my numbers and a graph.

title: Type 2 diabetic....
body: This is a great app! I got diagnosed with type 2 diabetes in October and this app helps me remember what meds I am taking and when. It also helps me decide what I can eat by what my levels are.

title: Was better!
body: I really appreciate the fact that it is free, but I think that they are trying to force you into buying the better app.

title: Glucose Buddy
body: This app has been so helpful in keeping track of my diabetic experience!! It has helped me to make adjustments in my eating habits!! Great tool for diabetics!! Would definitely recommend to anyone!

title: Update
body: Hate the update. It was so easy before you changed it. Is there anyway to use the old version instead?

title: What I need to stay encouraged!
body: To have a quality life requires keeping good records.  Keeping score in your health progress is critical.  Your software provides me that option!

title: Glucose monitor
body: I love this app. It is so much better than having to write down results & meals & keeping up with my steps.

title: BIG HELP!!!!
body: The only thing missing is a reminder that I can set every few hours or whatever to check certain pills, etc.

title: Perfect companion app for my Dexcom
body: This puts everything I need into one place and makes the information easily accessible. I think it will help me find more balance.

title: Don‚Äôt update!
body: While I‚Äôm irritated that this app wants to track my location- it‚Äôs none of their business- I‚Äôm beyond incensed that YEARS of my entries are gone. There is no need for the developers to remove that information. If you want to update this app, write your numbers down with a pen and paper first. I wish I had known this was going to happen. A warning would have been nice!

title: Good App
body: Pretty happy with this app. I wish the reports were easier to print and read. I just had a check up and my A1c was within .3 of GB‚Äôs estimate which is easily explained by the fact I don‚Äôt test regularly. Good app overall.

title: Helping me to manage
body: Used the app for several days now and find it easy to manage food intake, medicine and physical activity.  I plan to generate reports to take to my doctor‚Äôs appointments. So far, so good!

title: no daily tracking, hard to navigate
body: Free version fails to provide the most basic feature which is having the ability to simply track you day to day glucose levels. You need to wait for a weekly graph. The app is cluttered and seems to always have an add on the screen.  For straight forward, clear and easy tracking use the app Glucose.

title: Love it but..,
body: It is a great way to track my progress and to download for my doctor. My only complaint is the double markings of the results. I have to go back and remove them each time the app sync.

title: Keeps me accountable
body: Helps keep me on track. However, I liked it better before the update. It seems like it takes more steps.

title: Change of format and lacking support
body: I used GlucoseBuddy for years and was quite happy with it. Then the developer changed the format so that it was not possible to enter decimal points on medication dosages. When I tried to contact support, I found out out that there is no way to contact the developer!  Bad form!

title: Premium subscription does not work
body: After I subscribed, the app now says I am Premium member, but I cannot access anything to record my blood sugar

title: Stopped using
body: I decided to try this app because it had more downloads but i hate it. When I logged my food in it would always log it in as separate meals and i had to always fix it. It doesn‚Äôt give you the option for med reminders which i really need or to check my sugar. It really pushes you to upgrade. The only okay thing was it tracked my steps.

title: Great app
body: This app is great for tracking my blood sugars and blood pressure. It‚Äôs lacking the basic counters for calories and carbohydrates. If you want to pay for them you can but it should be included! That‚Äôs why I gave it a 4 out of 5 stars.

title: So Disappointed
body: This was once an easy to use method  to track my glucose numbers. My Dad who is now 86 has used it for several years; however, the continous ads have made it impossible for him to look at his historical dsta. We even considered premium but the cost is ridiculous. I am now loo k ing for just a simple log that keeps it easy and not frustrating!!

title: Just right
body: Easy to use and provides everything that I want in a record.

title: Would love to try it. If it would let me.
body: I would like to try this out before committing to such a large investment for a phone app.  But, with all the premium popups and restrictions on the free version I have no idea. I had to force close a couple of times to get out of ‚Äòupgrade to premium‚Äô pages.  Not worth any more effort.

title: Excellent system
body: Glucose Buddy is an excellent system if you are a Type 2 diabetic like me . I would advise to all diabetics to get one and you will be super happy to be part of this club.

title: Easy to use
body: This app has been extremely easy to use also easy to understand about entry very happy with this app

title: Love it
body: Have chronic kidney disease I am suppose to keep control not only of me Blood glucose but of my blood pressure and I am so great full to be able to do them both in one app

title: GREAT DIABETES TRACKER!!!
body: Wonderful app! Please add the ability to track and monitor blood pressure to from blood pressure makers like Withings or via the Apple Health database. Also, I really should be allowed to remove generated reports I no longer need.

title: Easy to use
body: Easy to use and track.  Works on both my iPad and phone, so I can track on either.

title: Date entry
body: This new date entry method: I don‚Äôt care for it! I prefer the spinning wheels. The first time I thought that something was wrong, because I didn‚Äôt see that tiny blue writing at the bottom of the screen.

title: I can‚Äôt use this app since the update
body: When I got this app about a month ago it felt like a lifesaver, easy to use & forgiving

title: Nice App
body: This is all new to me but this app keeps the records of my readings and can even email the results to my Doctor .

title: Finally!
body: Knowing that I have my ‚ÄúBuddy‚Äù tracking my diet and exercise has kept me on track. I think this app might be just what I‚Äôve needed!

title: Review
body: Allows me to monitor my glucose, weight, blood pressure, daily exercise regiment, monitor my calorie daily count, among many other options available.

title: This app is not free it should be
body: This app is not free not a lot of people whom are diabetics. You will have more customers to join the app. So make a free app. I will be deleting this app. Too much money to use. You shouldn‚Äôt take money from diabetics not right. They will do better with a free version of the app. There for I will not give you any stars. I will be back when a free version is made.

title: Sugar Control
body: I‚Äôve been looking for an app that helps me log my food and my blood sugar so I can achieve better control

title: Subscription DOESNT WORK!!
body: I purchased this app subscription to help me track my mothers glucose. I don‚Äôt mind paying for something I use.

title: Buyer Beware!
body: I purchased app, it looked good based on reviews, I thought why not? Then I purchased? O brother, now I feel like a caged rat. No way out no refund I even tried a few hours after purchase. I don't get it. It may be fine for some folks but it's not what I need. I want my money back. No customer satisfaction here I would give 0 stars but ..... stupid app won't allow it

title: Decent overall, but food entry severely lacks
body: Probably because of a much smaller user base, but the food entry lacks a lot and would be much better if it sync'd with other more common apps like MyFitnessPal.

title: Where can auto renewal be turned off?
body: I‚Äôve searched all over and cannot find the setting to change auto renew. No, it isn‚Äôt listed under my settings page.

title: A Sweet Friend
body: This app is easy to navigate and logs in lots of data.  It also imparts good information about one‚Äôs daily care of diabetes. It is a great encourager.  I recommend it.

title: Loving this app
body: Love this app keeps track of my blood glucose and activity and carbs also does a chart best app I have found! No problems so farüòä

title: Confusing
body: Couldn‚Äôt even figure out how to get the initial setup done. Kept telling me it needed access to my privacy settings but no matter what options I opened up apparently it didn‚Äôt like any of the choices I made. Had to abandon the set up. Was really hoping to find an app to track rather than on paper.

title: Glucose Buddy helped me :)
body: Glucose Buddy is so simple to use, and I won‚Äôt lose it like my paper tracker. I will probably upgrade to their premium version later.

title: WAY Overboard
body: I installed this app long ago. Did EXACTLY what I needed...tracking my glucose. THEN, wow, it became so cluttered with ads, useless junk (there may be some value to someone), that it‚Äôs became so difficult to be the simple glucose tracker I wanted that I had to dump it. So obnoxious. I wouldn‚Äôt mind chipping in to fund an app that was simple to use, AND THEN STAYED THAT WAY.

title: New Year 2020
body: Using this app has helped me in the past to help control my glucose numbers through accountability... Here‚Äôs to a better A1C year üòÅ

title: It helps
body: Anything that helps me is worth it. I may not be taking full advantage of the app now but plan to in the future.

title: Really liked it until
body: it deleted all of the food information I had entered for the day before and set everything to 0 for carbs. Having a list of multiple entries for 0 carbs is super unhelpful, not to mention the time I spent to enter everything on time to begin with.

title: Kimber Colt
body: It makes tracking my numbers so much easier and I especially like the a1c feature,

title: Change back to previous version
body: Timekeeping stinks with this version.  Was a great app.  But much harder to deal with now.

title: Pay for everything
body: The app looks nice, but don‚Äôt bother unless you‚Äôre willing to shell out $40-$70/month for ‚Äúpremium‚Äù. You can‚Äôt even send a basic report to your healthcare provider without paying and there‚Äôs ads everywhere, banners and pop ups. No thanks.

title: Disappointed
body: I thought by the star rating and the claim to be the top for 9 years that this would be a great addition to tracking my health. Once I downloaded it and opened it I found I could not use it as the description said unless I bought the premium. I can not afford $40 bucks. Very disappointed.

title: No excuses!
body: Great way to keep accurate record of your glucose levels. It‚Äôs there right at your fingertips-blood AND results!

title: Glucose buddy
body: Like others I used to use and love glucose buddy. I paid for the year and now can do very little other than log my blood sugars. I‚Äôm unable to email my doctor as well. I have found another. lose it. Com. You can log foods including BP/BS/and complete food log. I too am giving up this app. I just wish I could get my money back.

title: Great tracking
body: My doctor loves this as I track everything. As a type 1 this is important to see my treands

title: New version buggy
body: The new version released yesterday duplicates the glucose entries I make. Have to go in and delete the duplicate each time. Have tried various ways to enter glucose measure but it will always enter the measure twice. Have used the app ever since it was developed years ago.

title: Not enough exercise options.
body: Needs yard work such as push mowing added to exercise. Otherwise, free version is good. Sometimes crashes when saving a recipe. Reports are not available in free version.

title: Easy to use app
body: Very good APP; I will upgrade soon  to premium. Easy to use & has a lot of good information to help with controlling your Diabetes.

title: Bettie
body: Love this app and I use it every day Are used it every day but mine stopped working I clicked on it it comes up and goes right back off it won‚Äôt open for me and my subscription is it up until August 5 I just don‚Äôt understand why I quit working I even deleted it and re-download it it still doesn‚Äôt work

title: Glucose Buddy made a scary situation easy.
body: Four times a day this app is a welcomed source of continuity, inspiration and a desire to learn more about diabetes. This is the ONLY thing that has been easy from the first second I opened the app. May 2018, my 76yo Mom was at the ER. She didn‚Äôt know my name, mumbled and had major balance issues. It wasn‚Äôt a stroke but the result of her poorly managed T2D. After three weeks split between hospital and a rehab facility, we were back at the ER due to another episode. She was released 3am on Memorial Day with no access to her GP nor regular pharmacy, with confusing/ conflicting scripts for 3 types of insulin, new meds, and a freaked out daughter pretending to be calm. Desperate for an app that would help me, I found this one. The reviews and easy to comprehend screen shots sold me. Even negative or less than stellar reviews seemed to be constructive and many had replies. During this new journey with my Mom, this is the ONLY thing that has been easy. Having no clue what basal or bolus was, I entered her Humalog insulin and began recording. As things settled down and a routine was established, I decided to pay the yearly subscription and dug deeper into what this app offered. Our GP was now on vacation but called and wanted to see Mom‚Äôs glucose levels. Mom was prepared to write it all out in an email and was relieved when I simply sent a report from the app. Our GP was relieved and impressed. We‚Äôve since talked more about the app and both like how the simplicity of entering items on the patient‚Äôs side doesn‚Äôt detract from the detailed report that he as a doctor reads. As I now know what basal and bolus mean, I was able to go back and easily edit previous entries. The more we use this app, the more we are inspired to learn new ways to live with diabetes. This app is now on Mom‚Äôs iPhone in addition to mine. She is actively becoming more involved in entering her own information and even prepping and using her glucometer. Glucose Buddy has given her tools and a sense of feeling in control. As she gets three shots of Humalog a day and now uses a Lantus pen at night, this app has helped to establish a routine that has inspired new eating habits. She even carries her iPhone more now than before so she can record her steps. It‚Äôs a win win for everyone! We‚Äôre all enjoying a healthier Mom that wants to use her iPhone and has it with her for calls and FaceTiming. Thank you!!!

title: all looks, no substance.
body: This is the first negative review I write, preferring instead to contact the developer (being one myself).  But there is no excuse to charging $5.99 for a clearly half baked app.  Money which I just wasted and could have spent instead on diamedic, a competing app done much better.   And no I don't work for the competition.  You can check my other reviews for products such as weightbot and mSecure.

title: Almost perfect
body: Just to preface this - I have had type II diabetes for 20 years.  For the past four years I have been on insulin to control my diabetes.  I have also been running a Palm application to keep a log of my blood sugars and, carb intake, insulin use, etc.  Given the age of the Palm, an iPod touch seemed to be a good choice to replace it.

title: Love this program
body: Diabetes is tough, but Glucose Buddy 3.0 makes keeping track of the details easier. I've been using GB since version 1.0. It continues to improve and grow. Support is excellent and they listen to ideas and fix any issues. The new version allows you to choose more than one food or medication at a time. The application also loads faster than before. Now you can enter a numeric value for your glucose reading instead of rotating a dial. Adding entries is quick and easy. The log file has changed and is wider so the different colors for meds, food, activity and glucose do not show and the sorting capability is gone. Being able to sort the different types was very useful to me so I hope they add that back. While the graphs were removed this version, to me the more useful graphs are online. Putting the buttons on the bottom and having the application open to the log screen would also be good. I highly recommend this application. They are always working on improvements and it's still free. Thanks GB!

title: This app is great
body: I am using the reminders functon and the log.  Setup was simple, easy to understand and fast.  The push reminder function is excellent.  I had considered purchasing a seperate app for that purpose and no longer need to.

title: Great App! Happy to Have Sync!
body: I had reviewed an earlier version, and just got the new update and bought the 2-way sync. Had a few problems getting it going, but the developers were instantly responsive on their website forum and it's all working great now. Yep, it's pricey, but as I rely on my iPad more and more, I 'm glad to have all my records both there and on my iPhone. Also, I didn't understand the reviewer who said you can't go back and enter older records. Yes you can. I entered months of records, and update my BG numbers every several days.

title: Easy and Flexible with Exceptional Data Interpretation...The Best!
body: Congratulations on the development of a wonderful, easy-to-use, complete tracking program for those of us with Diabetes.  I have been using Glucose Buddy for nearly 4 months now and I wanted to take a moment to say how much I appreciate the application.   I am an analytical person that would enter my data into an excel spreadsheet each week and run a variety of plots to identify trends, look for opportunities to improve my control, and simply do a better job of understanding my bodies ability to accommodate sugar.  Sure there were lots of programs to record data but those were very weak with respect to analysis.

title: The Best and Effective So Far
body: As a newly diagnosed Type 2 I was very much concerned and interested in finding just the ideal app that would let me log my data, show me results immediately and something I could share with my Doctor at each visit.  I believe I've found it!  This app is not only user friendly but let's me visually see my results.  I especially like the graphs, the entries are easy to use and I can take a snapshot of my progress anytime.  The "topper" was the website and how I can access it from any computer and I can sync it with my IPhone!  One drawback that I can not award five stars is that my web entries do not sync to my IPhone but I can sync my IPhone logs to the website no problem.  That is confusing and lack of info when I want to share my data with my Doctor via my IPhone.  Log data on website does not match log data on IPhone.  On the biggest upside to this entire package is that it is all free both the IPhone app and membership to the corresponding site!  Free is good and this app is as well.  I will be looking for further updates, I really love this app!!

title: Was a great app. Now just ok and no support
body: Update #2: really disappointed in the support. Have been unable to sync the data between phone and computer. No way to back up data to the server. Has been like this for months. No response from app developer. It has good/easy user interface, but unless can back up and send reports to my doctor it has become worthless. Deleting the app.

title: Great helper
body: Update: 20 Sept. 2014. I have changed my rating from a one to a four as they seem to have finally fixed the issue where the data synching would fail for weeks at a time. For about the past two weeks I have had zero problems with the app. The reason I did not give them a five is that they never answer support requests. They need to understand they are in a customer service field of business, not just an app development business.

title: No Heath App integration
body: Count and med logging options are thorough. Charts and stats are top-notch,This may be useful for folk with Type 1 diabetes or others who MUST use medication to manage.  But the app suffers from not being integrated with IOS Health, and therefore not sharing information with other excellent Heath tools that are out there which a lot of people already use.

title: Diabetes helper indeed...
body: Downloaded this app a few minutes ago and am already very impressed. Easy to input numbers and easy to view.  would say that the first thing I noticed was the scroll wheel. obviously I'm a fan, after all, if Apple does it, then it's all right in my book. Another thing I saw was the option to send feedback directly through the program. Keeping as much as possible in the program (as opposed to having to open my own email client) is very beneficial for me so if I have any questions I can just type away.

title: Truly Awesome App
body: Updated Review:  Since my last review, which was nearly a year ago, I continue to be a big time fan of this application.  The advent of the A1C calculation has allowed me to keep really accurate check on where I am over any given 90 day period.  Therefore, there are never any surprises when I go into the doctor for my blood work every 6 months and I have found the calculated A1C results to be nearly identical to the lab.  I have been and continue to be an extremely well controlled diabetic of 20 years but this is the best tool I have ever had to assist me in staying healthy.  Thanks GB for such a GREAT application.

title: Best free app to manage your Glucose Readings, But HATE the ADs
body: I think that Glucose Buddy is the  Best free app to manage your Glucose Readings and better than some of the paid apps. But I HATE the ADs at the bottom of the screen!!!!!

title: Keeping me on track
body: Having this app in my phone where it is always handy has made keeping a detailed log so much easier for me. Being able to add details of activity, food, meds, weight, blood pressure, etc, makes for a great review with my endocrinologist. I can email her my logs before our appointment. The graph is a great visual aide. And it has helped me see my own patterns which has helped me get things under control.

title: Easy to use and great management tool
body: Made it very easy to track my gestational diabetes. With no experience this app was easy to use and learn. As a tool I heartily cite it as the reason why the docs said I had a successful pregnancy.

title: Extremely useful and simple
body: As a "new" diabetic I scrambled to find tools to keep track of my sugar levels in a way that would be practical.

title: Perfect for gestational diabetes
body: Have found it extremely useful to keep track of my BG since being diagnosed with gestational diabetes. The note part is great because I am controlling it with diet so I can note what I ate that gave the reading and understand better how to choose the next meal!

title: Wow...had issues, but they were fixed...and FAST...makes this app the best I've found.
body: What can I say...except Wow. I contacted the developer about my issues, and presto, they were handled immediatly. He contacted me to let me know that the fixes would be added to the next upgrade, stayed in contact to keep me abreast of the progress in getting the upgrade ok'ed by Apple. I beleive this whole process took less than a week. This developer, Tom, not only has the best diabetic program I've found on the App. store...he really cares about how his program fits your needs.

title: Can't beat it for a free app...
body: I've tried to find apps to manage type 2 diabetes, this one is pretty simple.  You have to enter the foods yourself, but only the first time.  Slowly you build up a library.  I also have a food called "carbs" to account for things like condiments, etc.  When you log in the foods, put the carb amount in the name, then when you choose it, you will know the number of carbs automatically because it's right there.  I use it to monitor my diet too, so when I log meat and cheese (0 carbs) you have to enter 1 because it won't accept 0.

title: Logging levels
body: Controlling BS is challenging. Working with your medical medical is vital for better BS control which require sometimes showing how your BS runs during a certain periods of time, all the time. This app is GREAT because it allows you to put it down immediately, it's put on graphs of your BS and makes a running list of when taken and add notes so when you go to see your physician, it's right in the palm of your hands to help you in in communicating your diabetic needs. Many like myself put forth an effort to keep good records but for some reason, you forget your log book on the day of your appointment, this app will allow you to be better prepared to show your doctor your logs and be ready to get the needed help for making the needed adjustments more accurately.

title: Awesome whole lot better than onetouch ultra smart
body: I just bought the onetouch ultra smart to keep up and log every little thing but this is way better. I also have the mini and never use it because I couldn't log it in the ultra smart. The founder being diabetic himself is what makes this app and future updates of this app so good. It's great that it is free now as I would have paid for it. Only suggestion would be a food database and place to put total calories and grams of fat carbs and protein. Maybe also ability to log glucose and insulin on same entry if it was taken at same time. It is awesome that it syncs to the website and can be emailed or printed. My doctor is going to love this because I HATE keeping up with my readings but this will make it so much easier. THANK YOU!!!

title: #1 fan of glucose buddy
body: This program has been the key to sucess in managing my diabetes. I have tried several other diabetes apps, this one has it together. My physican and dibetes staff can log in my acct anytime to check on my status and help me maintain perfect control. I would gladly pay $$$$ for this program anyday. No paper logs for my doc anylonger. It would be nice to have an option for a note field only, on main screen to describe health or other items your experiencing. Currently I have to list under the (4) standard options (glucose,meds,food,activity), also if this could allow you to add oral medication with mg doseage it would be great. Overall I recomend this to any diabetic. If I had an option for 10 stars

title: CMO
body: I just wanted to say Thank You!!! Life as a person with diabetes is not easy, especially with Type 1, it is a huge balancing act of not to eat too much, too little, too this, too that. ¬†Physical activities have to be planned out ahead of time and insulin/food has to be calculated accordingly. ¬†One miscalculation in my 5 shots/day and my entire day could be ruined. ¬†But your tool makes life a bit easier to deal with. ¬†I always have my iPhone with me, and don't have to worry about carrying a log book around. ¬†You graph things out, and allow me to dissect the information I've entered - all the stuff I used to do manually with excel. ¬†Now you've made that part of diabetes control automatic and easier - and for that, I say thank you from the bottom of my heart. ¬†Please continue helping us.

title: How do you do it free?
body: This is a short update. I'm changing to 5 stars. The graph has been added again. It got to be a hobby to find the best app. I bought and tried a couple more. This free app is the best of any. Very professional. The only thing I would like to see changed is an ability to make changes in data submitted mistakenly. Small problem, huh?

title: Fantastic app
body: This is a fantastic app.  Extremely professionally done, great graphics and very simple to use.  I have had it for several months and when I have had a question or two the support is almost immediate and superb.  I can not recommend this app strongly enough. And to top it all off it is free.  An app this well done could go for some serious coins if the owner so wished.  Mega congrats to him in trying to help us with this disease. The ability to sync the data to a web site is great too. The sync issue mentioned previously appears to be fixed and I got immediate response from their support in this regard. I have seen few sites to respond so qiuickly to a reported issue.

title: Glucose Buddy...
body: Update 20 Mar 10:  Played with this app for a while now.  I love it.  I have to say of all the apps I tried (and bought), this is by far the best one out there.  I am giving it 4 out of 5 stars though because of the email part of the app.  I would love it if there was a way to send only part of the entries and not have to send all of them each time.
