Maybe send only the last 2 weeks.  My Dr. does review the data but does not like getting every entry each time.  Just a thought.

title: Recommend not using Alarms/Alerts
body: This app used to be great. It's still good but is buggy now.  I recommend not setting any alerts or alarms. I set alerts for 8am, 5pm and 10pm so I can take my meds and insulin appropriately.  The alerts go off haphazardly (my 8am just went off 15 mins ago at 12:30 in the afternoon).  Even better, it went off SEVERAL DAYS after I had deleted ALL the alerts since they are useless!  They've been continuing to go off the past 2 days despite my having removed them... so I simply removed the app and will check when it's updated to see if it's less buggy.

title: Almost perfect
body: This is a terrific assist to managing my day. I am much better at maintaining my log because it's so simple.

title: Great app
body: As an active 21 y.o. Diabetic, o  always looking for something to work well with my lifestyle.. This integrated with the calorie tracker has really helped me as long as I stick with using it... The only part that is hard is finding the food from the grocery store in the app.. I tended to just make them in the favorites list and input the nutrition info myself.. You only have to do it once and then it's saves it :)... It would be easier if you could search it by different categories (for ex. "English muffins" and then all the English muffin brands would come up... If they were in order then you could also use that to find the lowest carb english muffins for example.. Just a thought :D)

title: Works Well On My IPhone 4s
body: I started using this app a few weeks ago and also got the weight program.  Sometimes it will not let me connect to the server when I sync but it does at a later time, so no big deal.  I like the data and graph, but they could be improved.  The data should be able to print full comments.  The graph should print larger and the advertising pop up should not blocking any parts of the graph when printed.  I like the program and use the free app.  I don't want the paid app and refuse also to pay an annual fee.  I give it a 5 for its ease of use and would like to see these minor items fixed. If they want to keep the fee ok, but one time only like most other apps.

title: Almost Perfect
body: Finnally a app that will do all that we diabetics need, well almost. It logs glucose, insulin or meds by type, let's you log carb in take and note what foods you ate, even let's you log activities like work outs or yard work. All that a good dr want you to keep a log of.

title: CHANGED MY LIFE
body: I was diagnosed with Type II in January. After doing a lot of research via books and the internet I realized the best way for me to keep my disease in check was a detailed log system that was easy, reliable and shareable.

title: Great app and great support!
body: I've been using Glucose Buddy since March and have been impressed with how easy it is to use. Today I upgraded to Version 2.0, a much more robust program with a neat web interface, and was completely blown away by the tech support I received. The problem I encountered with the upgrade was not with the program but rather with the weird format my doctor uses for his email. I received immediate replies from my inquiries to Glucose Buddy tech support until my problem got resolved.

title: Very Helpful App
body: My youngest daughter was recently diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes, and this application had proved to be very helpful in tracking her blood glucose, carbohydrates and medicines.

title: Perfect for managing Gestational Diabetes
body: This is a great app! I was diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes and had to learn how to live with testing and tracking very quickly. Glucose Buddy was easy to learn and use. I had to report my levels to my doctor weekly and it was very easy with the reports I could generate with Glucose Buddy. It would have been much harder for me to control my gestational diabetes without this app, I would have never been able to keep so organized. I gave birth to a healthy, 7lb6oz boy and I am certain that has everything to do with keeping on top of my diabetes because of Glucose Buddy.  So thank you so much!

title: Disappointed in paid features
body: I have been a long time user of glucose buddy, WT Tracker and the blood pressure tracker and when I saw that all had been incorporated into a single I was the ready to jump on that.  I am now disappointed. The incorporation was a great idea but the overall organization is terrible.  All logs come on a single list  I think different screens to track different items would be a much better way to go.  And when the logs are emailed. they come up jumbled together.  I seriously doubt that my doctor will want those charts.

title: Awesome app!
body: I have 2 children ages 5 and 7 both are type 1 diabetics. We test every 2 hrs  10 to 12 times daily for each child.  This app has made it so easy to keep up with the hundreds on numbers we input and email to our endocrinologist every 3 months. both of my children's a1c levels are between 6.0 and 6.5 every 3 months. This is a must have app if your serious about tight blood control.  The only thing I wish is that you could have more than one user or profile on 1 app. I have to use an iPhone and an iPod to have individual profiles for each of my kids.

title: Busy, great app
body: I'm a fourth year student at OSU and this app is great. I can sync all my info between my iPad and my phone which is extremely useful. It also let's me log everything from food to glucose to exercise. The partnering with the calorie counter also has helped me lose weight. Sometimes the calorie counter can crash but just open it again and its fine. I love that everything is pushed online and my doctor can see everything I do. Can very finely tune my pump settings.

title: Excellent!
body: Excellent app to track blood glucose and medications.  Syncs to my iMac & iPad flawlessly.  Don't waste your money on the Calorie Tracker option... It's not ready for "prime time"... Crashes and needs too much input if you want to track your typical foods.  But, Glucose Buddy without Calorie Tracker is very useful and works without any problems.  Makes no sense to keep a paper log anymore!

title: Nearly perfect, and free
body: Easy to keep track of blood glucose, meds, and food intake. Love the graph of blood glucose levels over time, being able to email records, and especially sync with my son's iPod touch from afar to help him manage BG. Would like to be able to sum up carbs from app. And it's not easy to print/email selected records... You have to share large chunks of data. Also, when we got charged more than once for taking advantage of syncing across multiple devices, the app store folks did not quite get why we were not supposed to be charged! But eventually it worked out. Using this app has given our family tremendous peace of mind as we learned about our son's new diagnosis of type-1 diabetes.

title: on the right track but...
body: I've been testing this and two other similar diabetes-oriented trackers for two weeks. This one's in 2nd place...the interface is ok, though there seem to be a few more touches required than necessary for several of the steps. Also there's a 3-4 second loading lag at the start. These may seem small but entering 4 glucose readings a day, exercise record and meals and snacks means 8 or more sessions, day in and day out, so delays are a disincentive to stay with the app. Also only glucose is graphed. Also, no daily totals for carbs. No tracking of calories, blood pressure or weight, which are just as important as glucose.

title: Best Diabetes App!
body: I'm so happy I found this app. I paid a ton for Diabetes Pilot, which was not very good at all, then found this much better free app after the fact. Go figure. I'm a Type 1 diabetic and this has been great for me. It's really easy to enter all of my data. Everything is categorized nicely and the program is really easy to navigate. It's also great that it syncs with their website, which provides even more detailed graphs and other information. The website gives you your highs/lows/avgs for a variety of different scenarios such as: time of day, meal, etc. This app is fantastic!

title: Must-have for any diabetic!
body: Before GB writing up my blood sugar, meds, exercise, foods etc with the date, time and notes was a time sucker.  When you're checking three times a day that adds up.  With GB it takes me a matter of seconds to record everything!

title: GB A1C checks out perfectly with lab results
body: I have been using Glucose Buddy for several months now, and I recently went to my doctor for my three month checkup.  I thought to go online and run the GB A1C prior to going in, and also printed the log out to show the doc.  I told him what I was doing, and that GB predicted my A1C at 7.08%.  The doctor doubted the results stating that patients with my control level and medicine dosage, not to mention my history, are above 8%.  Never the less, he jotted down the Glucose Buddy A1C estimate.  When the lab test results came back, they were EXACTLY as Glucose Buddy predicted.  Hats off to Glucose Buddy!

title: The designer needs to upgrade some features
body: First thing the designer needs to address is allowing people who weigh over 342 to allow them to enter their proper weight, I stand 6' 8" and weigh 380lb, why would a designer not allow for weight under a 1000 lb. mark just so to allow room for everyone and also how their weight is entered should be keypad entry instead of spin wheel.

title: Buggy App, Deplorable Support
body: This could be a good app. Entries are easy to make and logs export to email in a decent format, although the inability to select a date range for export is clunky.

title: Disappointed
body: With the number of stars this app has, I expected more.  I guess I should have read more reviews first, but everything I entered on the computer doesn't come up in app, which also means if I email my logs to myself/ my Dr from the app, none of those records are included. Debating deleting them all from the computer & manually re entering them in app.

title: Ease and graphs are a plus!
body: A type II diabetic for 8 years, I was beginning to get lazy about taking my readings.  My last doctor visit proved how dangerous this had become.  My A1c level had risen significantly. Shocked by how much in as little as 3 months, I quickly went looking for an app to help keep me on track.  I really like the ease of entering in my readings and the correct descriptions  that correspond to each.  It has worked because it has provided a better visual of how I am doing and has encouraged me to continue to stay in my correct range. Ease and graphs are what make this app a good choice.

title: Worthless
body: I used to have this app a few years ago on my old iPhone. Now returning to it there are a lot of features that were taken out and I don't want to pay for them when I already had them for free.

title: Almost there...App extras don't work
body: I've been using this app for 2 weeks now.  While it is great to track blood, food and exercise...there IS NOT a seamless integration into calorie track app, nor printing report for doctor, nor setting up notifications. If the developers actually listened to the comments and questions posed by the users perhaps they could update their user interface and user experience and make this a more user friendly app.

title: Great program!
body: Out of the free logs, I like this one the best. However, my son was only recently diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, and his bgl tends to go all over the place, especially when he doesn't keep track of things as well as bye should!  The biggest detractor from this program is that it used the "dials" in order to enter numbers. A key pad would be so much easier, and it wouldn't have a 400 level limit on bgl. The only other "opportunity for improvement" that I see, is each log entry should be entered on its own line when exporting the log. As it is now, I have to copy and paste it into a text file on my desktop in order to manually review the logs.

title: Great Application!
body: I've been using this application for about a month and it's a great way to track the different variables that impact your glucose values. The web sync is especially useful if you want to use the data in other ways, it's all there and you're not dependent on the iPhone to keep the data. I had to reinstall programs on my iPhone and tried to access the web, had some problems, but customer support had the answer almost immediately.

title: Great update but needs charting back.
body: I've been using this lil app for the past year, since I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. It's a life saver, literally. The updates recently made to the app are awesome, they've completely revamped the entire interface and everything's works great! However it is now missing the key charting feature. I understand some things might have needed to been cut with the entire overhaul, but this charting feature was an excellent way for me to discuss my glucose levels with my doctor during visits. Please bring this feature back. Otherwise a perfect lil app!!!

title: Bring the graphs back!
body: I have loved this program and have even prefered it over one of other apps I paid for. But without the graph function it becomes worthless for me even my doctor prefers the graph as it is easier to look at a trend then indvidual logs. Nice look on the new interface though taking away features for a prettier app does not help. Put the graph back and easily a 5 star app again.

title: Very helpful!
body: I used to record all my bg results, meds, food, etc. in an Excel spreadsheet, but this is much more comfortable/mobile. No more need to scribble my notes on a piece of paper until I get to my computer, heh.

title: AWESOME!!!
body: This app is why I have an iPhone. I love this app and I've only been using it for the past three months. One drawback, when you email numbers to the doc, it sends them ALL. It would be awesome to send a range (1 week, month, etc). My doc informed me she printed 25 pages of my blood sugar numbers and asked if I would do the slightly annoying task of deleting some of the old numbers. Wouldn't be too much of a problem, but I'm emailing twice a week as I'm getting into the last couple of weeks of my pregnancy. All together this is great and has saved me time and money already!!! Thanks!!!

title: MUST HAVE FOR DIABETICS!
body: I love all the features it has! I love the graph the most. I can get a good idea of what I run BG wise. Also love the note section, inputting my sugars and insulin in the same log and having it sync to an online account that can give you an idea of your A1C and a more in depth look at your trends. I just wish you could sync from a computer to device and not just visa versa. Also wish there was something that gave you a number for you averages and not just a graph. But over all a MUST have for all diabetics! No more pen and paper and no more running out of space writing when logging! ;)

title: need bug fixes
body: This app works great and seems to be the best out there. However, there are many bugs that need to be fixed. I paid for the weight function however I only can enter that through the iPhone not the website. The graph display on the iPhone allows only one add-on to be displayed even though website indicates multiples can be displayed. The print out all of the graph on the website is in accurate and you cannot change the defaults for what is displayed. Moreover, the developer is never answered any of my questions. I have had this for a few weeks now and the jury is still out as to it's worth of $6.99.

title: Should be a 5-star but...
body: Plain and simple interface, but I'd love to have a field where I could input (and SEE!!!!) the meals I'd eaten. As it is, there IS a "Notes" field, but it's one tiny, narrow box that doesn't expand; you can enter data endlessly, I suppose, but it's impossible to read. Other than that one complaint, GB is a simple, easy-to-use straightforward app with a lot of features. One HUGE plus: almost all features are available without needing the Pro version, and even without the Pro version, you don't get slammed with stupid ads or requests to upgrade. Highly recommend this one. üëçüèº

title: This app is a lifesaver!
body: My son was recently diagnosed with type one diabetes, and this app has made our life much easier. My wife and I can enter his numbers wherever we happen to be and then sync them to the website, so we can be aware of what's happening to him whether we are with him or not. This is especially helpful when dealing with transitions from one caregiver to another. The ability to print reports for doctors and send them electronically as well is also a huge asset. I highly recommend this app. It is the best one I found.

title: The Best I Have Used Personally!
body: I have used many apps since they have come oout and Glucose Buddy beats them all for ease of use and for information gathering. I love the way it syncs with the desktop and my I Phone and I enjoy being able to e-mail results to the Dr's as they are warranted. As a diabetic who checks his blodd 6 to 7 times a day this tool is invaluable. Thanks to the team of Tom and Matt and the rest of the crew for making this product number one in the eyes of myself and many of our community members at Diabetic L.I.F.E. *WON*.

title: Great App/Platform For: Logging/Extrapolating Carb/Insulin/BG/Activity Data
body: I'm fairly tech savy and was amazed after Dx in 2008 at the dearth of usable software available on OS X or the iPhone platform for diabetic data logging and extrapolation. GB is easy to use, syncs to a web site that makes using and viewing the data meaningful, has some some cool graphing tools and is free to boot.

title: By far the best diabetic management app so far
body: I've looked at EVERY diabetes logging app on the iTunes store (to the tune of about $25), and this one is by far the most comprehensive and easy to use. The ability to record food and glucose AND medications AND activities all in one place is well thought out and really slick. The only part I would improve is the documentation of how the event alerts work -- it's not too hard to figure it out, but as well designed as the rest of the app is, it's a rough edge that really doesn't need to be there.

title: Glucose Buddy is Great
body: I've been using the Glucose Buddy ap for the past month.  It have been very easy and convenient for me to keep track of my blood glucose levels and activity.  I especially like the graph function that gives me a visual way of evaluating my glucose levels.  I also like the way it uploads to the website where I can view other information.

title: Can't live without it!
body: I am so happy that I found this app admit makes my life so easy and accountable.  Diabetes is not easy no matter what type you are and being able to print off everything you and your Doctor needs is awesome.  If you don't think this helps to keep you on track try not logging BS and food for a week and see.  Just saying as I did and wow not a pretty picture.  Couple this with " Lose it " and you will have a perfect marriage.  Please keep up the food work.

title: Love it
body: I had the old product and it was easy to log items, but this new product is above and beyond what I ever expected from this application. I can read results from my iPhone and sync with their system so I can check it any where. The comparison between this version and the previous one is unbelievable. If you need a tool to help track, this is the only one you will need. Only thing i wish they'd add is the opportunity to add A1c values when they are tested. Go for this one.

title: Could be better
body: I do like this app but think it could be improved.

title: Easy. Simple. Now works. I like it!
body: I just downloaded GB. Looked interesting. Will not let me set my meter's name. It keeps "selecting for me". Then, keeps saying my Login is incorrect every time I go to a different screen. I'M ALREADY logged in! Seems to have a lot of glitches for such a highly reviewed app. I'll try it over the next few days to see if I can actually get it to work. Designer needs to monitor how app is doing.

title: Gestational Diabetes
body: Just diagnosed with gestational diabetes and have to test 4x per day. My doctor gave me a sheet to write everything down on but found this app to be easier for me during the day while at work and away from home. I just write everything down on my doctors sheet at the end of the day. I would like to be able to set some parameters on the graph. I'm also having trouble loading my meter brand/info - app always shuts down when I try. Otherwise a great app for keeping basic info on my readings - very happy with it and definitely recommend.

title: Doesn't actually do everything it says it does..
body: I was actually impressed with this app. I'm glad I waited to upgrade to the $7 version, as it is missing features that they advertise it performs. I would have rated this 5 stars if it actually had reminders/push notifications like it says it does. Being the parent of a newly diagnosed type 1 diabetic teenager, I was looking forward to her being able to use the reminders so she wouldn't miss testing her sugar or taking her insulin. But that feature does not exist like the app states it does. So for now it only gets 2 stars in my book and I'll find an app that performs its stated features... with reminders.

title: Love this app!!!!
body: I love this app.  My 14 year old son has Type 1 diabetes and this has helped me greatly with keeping up with his blood sugar.  I could never get him to write his numbers down.  Now I just ask him each night and add it to my phone.  He is getting an Ipod touch for Christmas.  I hope by getting this app for him,  he will record his numbers himself.

title: What a relief!
body: Thank you for this app! I was just diagnosed two weeks ago, I was so excited to see this app for my iphone! I always have my phone with me so this is perfect to be able to log everything in! I was trying to use a carb tracker as well but found that putting everything into this app and then using the graphs on the website work wonderfully! Especially for someone who is just learning! I am much more likely to type something into my phone as opposed to write it down! Thank you so much! :)

title: WOW, thank you!!!!
body: Have had app for only a few days & wow, you guys are life savers!!!  If you are a diabetic and don't have this app you are not managing your diabetes the way you could.  Its FREE, everyone who is a diabetic knows how hard it is to give your doctor the right information, no more excuses, no more pens, no more paper, get this app & let it do it's thing... easy to use, makes tracking my day to day diabetic life easier...only one wish, PLEASE, update to include a oz. to gram conversion for food inputs, so much easier to find portion sizes in oz., other than that, best app on MY iPhone

title: There's An App For That...This One!
body: As a new diabetic, I was overwhelmed with stuff to keep track of; but as a computer teacher, I joked to my wife that there must be an app for this, and then I found Glucose Buddy!

title: amazing software
body: this software is an answer to prayer for a parent of a 8 yr old type 1 diabetic. the ability to sync up allows his mother to keep it up to date when he is with her. no need to hand over paper logs etc. I truly believe this was written by a diabetic as there were no stones left unturned here. everything was thought of. I admit that I downloaded it because it was free, but all the upgrades for in app purchases were worth every penny. I highly recommend this app!

title: Needs some work
body: Although Glucose Buddy has done a better-than-average job providing information categories to track, entering data is VERY awkward and poorly designed. Examples: If you want to transfer your data from software in another platform, for instance, you will need to do it all through manually; each date must be entered by spinning a wheel with no separate 'year' component. Entering the meter reading itself requires re-selecting the field after choosing a description for that event. Programmers could easily make this a much more user-friendly app.

title: Very helpful
body: I've been a diabetic for 2 years now and  I never even checked my glucose until my son was born this past November. I realized that I needed to start taking care of myself. This app has certainly helped me gain better control of my glucose and time my metformin doses around my highest and lowest glucose times. It's super easy to use! You can make notes , change times and dates, track weight, and view a linear graph showing your progress. TOTALLY WORTH THE DOWNLOAD!!!!

title: I hate to be that guy but the support is awful and they sell your info to marketers
body: This is new to me. I think GB appears to be a fairly decent app, but I have no experience with others.

title: Very poor, and I'm very sad.
body: I first got this app a year ago and it was the best thing ever. I use this app every day keeping a measure of my blood glucose. But this year periodically it would not work, it would always give me a message saying that it could not connect to the server. At first it was every couple of days and then those days turned into more days in succession. I then sent a email to support but got no answer or response. Now it will not work at all I uninstalled it and reinstalled it still will not connect I added a new one it worked twice that was it so I will not be using this product anymore it's a shame.

title: Sometimes you find a gem
body: This really does feel like a buddy. The care and thought that went into making this app speaks of the developer's desire to fill a gap with a product that exceeds what one would come to expect to find in the App Store. When I say that, what I mean is that we've all went looking for a particular app with the hopes that we /might/ be able to find something remotely useful and settled for mediocrity. I didn't find mediocrity... I found a buddy. (How sappy was that, eh?)

title: This app has helped me emmensly
body: This app just keeps getting better and better. I have used this app since February 2009. It has an intuitive and organized interface that's easy to use. I have much better contol of my sugar levels because of this app. My doctor loves the level of detail that was otherwise missing in the handwritten logs. Support has gotten back to me on any issues that I have had. Keep up the great work and thanks.

title: Just what I was looking for
body: Glucose Buddy is just the kind of iPhone-based diabetes log I was looking for. I have tried Islet and Diabetes Log; Glucose Buddy is much better. I like being able to do custom notes to all entries. My life is not routine, so it's nice to catch the nuances of each situation in my notes. Syncing iPhone entries with my online account is awesome. People typically don't just use their iPhone or pc.. The added flexibility of reviewing and editing on both devices is key.

title: Updated from 2 stars to 4
body: Awesome note from tech support. It did not solve my particular issue, however at least there was an explination. And answered in on a Sunday, less than 12 hours from the time I sent the message.

title: Had to delete
body: Could not get it to web sync. No reply on that issue from tech support. I like the program, but has several shortcomings (see comments on deleting meds, too-cumulative daily average info, etc.) that have not been addressed.  No updates of late. I think the money for app development has gone away and the program is "matured" to where there will be fewer improvements. That said, it's the best free app I found and I liked it. But I seleted it today and went with a $6 paid app that does all this and more including nutrition info. Best of luck.

title: You better get back some of the old functionality
body: I gave the earlier version 5 stars. It was a fabulous app and very flexible. The new version: 1) no graph; 2) you can't really see the note entry because it's all squished in one small space now; 3) more steps involved with entering data into the log - it was good having the log on the first screen. The only totally new function (other then a lot of rearranging) is the learning module which is complicated and not very helpful. I could match thing up before with the downloaded file with more ease than the rigid function that appears to be sponsored by a pharmacy.

title: This is a no-brainer!
body: What better way to see how you are doing EVERY DAY! I have been faithfully entering my levels every day for the past 9 months. Every so often I "read the graphs" and it really helps me to keep on track. I can tell when I am anxious, or sick and can leave notes to myself to describe where I am. I show my doctor as well. With medication, my levels fall into the pre-diabetes range and I keep to PORTION CONTROL as well. My A1C is at 5.9. That's great. Love this app!!!

title: 75% of the needed solution.
body: When I learned that I was diabetic, I went searching for the one killer app that would track my glucose, activity and food intake, and Glucose Buddy does this well.  I like the fact that I can dump the results into Excel and create my own reports, but the missing item here is a food database to enable quick recording of caloric/carb intake.  I use MyFitnessPal for this purpose.  Together the two apps fit 100% of the need.  Integrating the two or developing the functionality inside GB would be even better.

title: Nice and simple
body: Easy to use. I like that. But what these apps are all missing for me is the ability to alert me when it's time for my meds. Especially needed is for the meds that need to be taken before a meal. The alert should persist until I clear it, and be able to sleep if I'm not ready and tell it to. Most of all, and the hard part for the developers, is that it be able to "wake" my iPhone when on standby, but on. Right now I'm using the phone's "alarm" feature, but that's pretty awkward.

title: Effective and Accurate According to My Doctor
body: This app is highly effective and accurate. My doctor asked me to check my blood sugar and a minimum of twice a day, at least three times a day and the check once before a meal and once after email to see how it affects my blood sugar. He wanted to go through the data with me at my next appointment, and the south made that very easy because I can go online and print out my chart.

title: Perfect for tracking, sending logs
body: I developed gestational diabetes and this app has been fantastic for keeping a log of my daily readings. Plus I can email the log to my doctors. I use it along with Daily Carb - that app has been good for looking up carb values of food. It'd be great if a feature like that could be incorporated into this app.  And it'd be even better if I could plug in an amount of carbs (say 15g) and a food (say quinoa) and have it tell me how much I could eat.

title: Help me get healthy
body: I contribute much of my A1C lowering by .5% to this application.

title: Thank You
body: For those who are new to Diabetes they have yet to find the biggest problem, getting back on the wagon when you fall off! Logging (through a windows app) all the time kept me going when I first encountered this monster, my BG, food and weight, but when I went on vacation and this wasn't possible it was hard to keep it going!

title: I want the old version back!!!
body: I loved this app and was excited to see the update. The facelift is great and keypad entry was essential and really makes log entries much faster. But bring back my graphs and ability to filter the log by entry type!!!  The graphs were my motivator and what set this thing apart from a paper log for me. I loved to be able look at the graph and see the hi/low/avg plotted - really helped me keep tight control.

title: Excellent app - very impressed
body: This app does almost everything I want it to, and the only thing lacking - a sync between the web and the iPhone so that both sides have all information, whether entered in the web portal or on the iPhone - is in development as we speak.

title: Yeah it free but at what cost?
body: I downloaded and used this application along side with three other free applications. It is easy to use and pretty straight forward ap. It does what it promises but the big issue is sharing your data with unknown 3rd parties. I would probably be OK with that if they named who the 3rd parties were and what they are doing with the data. If they data was used for improving treatments or such but I pretty sure it just for marketing purposes. It would be a nightmare it your insurance was qualifying you diabetes compliance.

title: It's Great!
body: I've had Type 1.5 for 20 years and haven't been the best about testing frequently enough. I also could never be bothered with handwritten logs. Well this app has changed everything! I'm checking 4-5 times a day now and thanks to the log I'm able to finally bolus properly for meals. My graph also shows how much better my control has become in just 2 weeks. This app is a must!

title: Just what I needed
body: Great App! I updated to the premium package because I was tracking my Blood Pressure and Weight in the activity section, it is very nice to have the BP and W plot capability in one package. Recently I when on line to print out my three months results for my doctor's visit. My Doctor can now get a plot to include in my records and has a better since of my progress, I will continue to use this tool, it is just what I needed, thanks

title: LOVE IT!
body: Best diabetes app ever! Very easy to use, perfect 2 print out and take 2 doctors appts, everything i need is all rite here! Thnx!

title: Very friendly app... But a few changes could make it great!
body: I like this app a lot and believe me, I have tried many. I like that entries are very easy to make and that it is user friendly. However, when emailing logs to myself/doctor, insulin units are shown in a different line and are hard to read. Also, you can't select the range of dates when emailing logs. Finally, logs should be displayed from the latest to the most recent and not viceversa. Nonetheless, please note that this is the best app that I have tried thus far.

title: Very easy to set up/use
body: Just got diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes and I needed something that would allow me to keep logs easily & allow me to share them with my provider easily.  As it stands, this app is perfect for me and my lifestyle. I highly recommend it.

title: A Terrific Program now with Full Sync Capabilities
body: I've been using this App for sometime now and thought it was just great. ¬†NOW, they that upgraded to sync with their website, it leaves me in awe. ¬†One terrific program with the ability to sync data for easy viewing. ¬†This App has gone well above and beyond any of my¬†expectations. A full five Stars to you.

title: New version is great again
body: The new update is great. The graphs are back and you can add new entries from the logs page. The only thing they haven't added back yet is being able to sort logs by type (meds, food, glucose).

title: Great Idea but not perfect
body: I would give GB 5 stars but the app won't let me save items that have been input under Meds Food & Activity headings. It's a free program and is great to keep track of your BG. I was planning to get the update except it was a pay add-on. I'm glad I didn't considering it is getting terrible reviews. Instead of adding new stuff on, make it easier for new users to be able to fully use the app. (maybe a dedicated faq/instruction page so users don't have to search for answers to coomon problems)

title: Excellent App, but...
body: Slick interface, very user-friendly. Nice graphs and the ability to take a picture of the graph and text or email it is great.

title: All you need is blood!
body: This app is great. It tracked a lot if the effort and guess work out if tracking your glucose levels and modifying your diet to make diabetes management both easier and more effective.

title: Works Great for What I do Use of It!
body: I really didn't use the calorie burning portion because I use another system through my gym that has its own tracking system. I've never had a single problem using it to track and record my sugar levels. My sister is a nurse and loves that it downloads and emails accurately and correctly in an easy to read format for doctors.

title: Easy to use.
body: I have always depended on written logs or Excel spreadsheets to log in my numbers. Once I missed a few entries, I would just stop logging. With Glucose Buddy on my iPhone, I can log in my numbers immediately and then send them straight to my doctor. It isn't a cure, but it sure makes living with Type 2 much easier.

title: Great app, wish it was fully compatible
body: This app is easy to use and is flexible for the types if data you might want to keep track of.  Super easy to use on the  phone and after you upload the data to the website, produces a variety if graphs that help you spot trends. Printing ability is too limited--you only get the best graphs from Explorer--any other browser you need to do screen shots. Otherwise great for a fee product.

title: So much potential
body: This is a very basic logging app for diabetics. Data entry is easy but the phone app is chart isn't very useful. You sync your entries to the PC version (which looks like a 1990s spreadsheet) where there's more functions even. With this last update sync has become unreliable and server not available errors happen frequently. Happily, when the sync is made, no data is lost. Sadly, considering how many diabetics there are, no one has created the perfect app.

title: Helpful and Simple to Use
body: This app makes it simple to log you BG (other things, but I don't use them) quickly and easily. It gives you a daily average of your BG as well as the high and low on a neat little graph, which is handy to glance at. I've not yet tried any of the web-based features.

title: v3.0 is disappointing and worse than older version...
body: V2 was a great tool - showed charts and allowed you to edit foods. v3 has removed charts, and the UI, while more slick, has an inferior user interaction. MYLEstone, please add the following. (1) Allow upto 400lbs weight, (2) A height of 5'11 always shows up as 5'10, (3) Allow user to edit/delete foods, (4) Do not gray out the numberpad if user opts to not select 'add food', (5) The dial on the 'food tab' is too large and makes the page display poorly, (6) display chart as in previous version.

title: UPDATED:  Back to loving my GB app
body: I realize that I was able to use the Glucose Buddy program for almost a year without any fees or charges.  I was also using 2 other apps to track the weight and BP, so imagine my excitement when one of my favorite and most useful programs was adding all that into the one app for a small fee of $2.99.

title: Diabetes Management Made Easy!
body: This is the perfect tool for anyone with diabetes; particularly for someone who has been recently diagnosed.  Knowledge is power and this program provides everything you need to be able to get ahead and stay ahead of your disease and have some degree of control over your own destiny.  My diabetes educator loves the e-mail reports and has recommended BG Buddy to many of her patients.

title: A controlling "buddy"
body: The biggest reason for the downgrade is the greedy across device sync fee of $13. Come on! It's my data!! They want to charge me to load my own data onto different devices? Sham on them.

title: Very helpful app
body: I am a newly diagnosed Type II diabetic and an avid iPad user. Immediately after diagnosis, I went shopping for blood sugar tracking apps. I probably tried about a dozen apps looking for one that was a good fit for me. After more than a month of app trials, this one remains in my top three favorites. I really like that it has the ability to also track A1c results. It is easy to use with many options. I can easily recommend it.

title: Glucose Buddy
body: I really like the way the log is set up for recording notes with my glucose readings. I like the graph and the fact that I can look for patterns and if there is any reading that is unusually high or low, I can instantly refer back to my log.  I have not used the other facets of the program but there are other areas where I can add info or connect with other devices.

title: Great tracking app
body: I didn't need anything complicated as I got gestational diabetes and just needed to track my levels.  I love how with a few taps I'm able to log my level select time of day and which reading I was making, but also make notes as to what I ate to see if one food made a difference over others.    Love the graphing and email features as well! Perfect!

title: Bogus Graph Plots
body: Instead of plotting my readings by time, which is important to gauge impact of daily activities, it groups the plots by high, medium and low. That has little utility for me since I can't look back and relate a score to a daily activity. Also, it often adds a BOGUS entry on the graph for a test I didn't take!  It looks like it does an average of my high and low scores and creates a graph entry in between. Totally false!!!  Even if I take a third test, the bogus entry remains. Right now the only utility for me is the logging feature. And I could do that with Apple Note. I won't buy this app.

title: Don't Waste Your Money! This is total junk!
body: I know many people don't like negative reviews. However, if I would have known this app was so worthless I would not have made the "in app" purchase. I'm really getting sick and tired of Apple allowing worthless app makers like this one to have their cheap apps listed.

title: Simple logbook output not available
body: After looking at many of these apps it seems difficult for any of them out put the logbook with the easiest of information like date, time, glucose reading , meal type (before or after meals or bedtime or waking up) and notes in a list format.

title: Best with pre-planned meals.
body: It's got a good interface. I found it easy to make entries and I liked the reports. On the down side you have to figure out how many carbs you ate by some other method. There is no access to a food list, not even one you create yourself. Not a problem if you pre-plan your meals, and it's easy enough to remedy by pairing up with another food app of your choice if you don't mind switching back and forth.

title: Why pay when the best app is free!!
body: This app is by far my most used app. I can keep track of everything for my gestational diabetes and sync it to their website. The support is awesome, they are very responsive to all my emails. I paid for another diabetes app and ended up deleting it because this one has everything I needed and did it better. Keep up the great work!!

title: Totally Recomended!
body: Great App! I was so lost when I was first diagnosed. I knew I didnt want to keep my logs the old fashioned way. This app has comprehensive logs for all needs, gloucose readings, food, meds and activies. I am able to email my logs to myself and import into Excel to print for the doctors records. Also, got fast response to my questions from the developer, excellent CS! Better then any of the other diabetes apps I have tried!

title: Update: so far so good and getting better!
body: Wow! So far I'm impressed! I've been using Diabeties Pilot for Palm OS for years and this app is a nice migration with familiar logs and features. The ability to directly email logs and take a snapshot of the graph is wonderful! My only suggestion at this point would be to add the actual estimated A1C average according to the BG average.

title: Tickled to find this as a FREE app!
body: Devastated when I discovered I have diabetes, but finding this app has helped a LOT! I was making a log in my notepad, then found this and realized it has the ability to send my record of BS readings to my doctors email! It also has a LOT of other bells and whistles I haven't taken the time to play with, but it's definitely worth your time! Thank you Glucose Buddy! (:

title: Great except for 1 thing
body: This app is easy to use, and I love the graph feature. The only thing I would fix is that when you are entering a log, there is no "felt low" or "felt high" tag. So if I check and I'm 50, a week later I won't know if I actually felt low or I happened to be low at a regular check. But other than that, this app is awesome! If they fix that one problem I would definitely give it 5 stars.

title: A Great way to track blood sugar
body: Nice app.  At its core is a quick and easy way to record blood sugar levels on the iPhone.  Save them to the server and sign up for a free account and you can analyze the data via all sorts of tracking charts.  Brought them to my doctor and blew her away with the detail.  No substitute for real lab testing but a great way to verify you are on track with your efforts.

title: Love it
body: I love this app. I have it on everything, my iPod, iPad, and phone. I can plug in my numbers on any of them and know I can find everything on my computer when I need it. I import to Excel, print and have all my numbers to show the doctor. I can even graph and print that.

title: Very helpful tool
body: Recently diagnosed with type 2 and this app has been a huge help with recording my readings and even notes as to what I ate or what exercise I did.  The best part is that I can go into the website and print off a very nice report to show my Dr.  at my next appt.  it has helped me learn what foods do what to my blood sugar.  Would highly recommend this app to anybody needing to track their blood sugar.  Also the support forum is nice too.

title: Useful Tool!
body: The upgrade and changes took a little adjusting to get used to, but the. Ew look and information you get are amazing! I like how you can now see an overall picture that includes your steps, weight, and glucose numbers that day. I also like the way your glucose numbers are represented, but I do miss the line graph depiction, overall really nice update!

title: Version 2 Will Not Open
body: I have used this program faithfully to manage my type 2 diabetes.  It is a great program. However, when I downloaded version 2, the program will not open, even if I reboot my iTouch. Do not download version 2 until they work out the bug--you will lose access to the program completely.

title: A convenient and powerful tool. The best I've seen in 25 years of diabetes management!
body: Powerful, easy to use tool.

title: Awesome app!!
body: Thanks for designing an app that makes it super easy to track my glucose and other data. Paper logs didn't work for me and I wasn't as careful as I should have been, but this app has changed all of that!

title: A fabulous tool!
body: Granted I'm hoping I only really have to keep up with this until the birth of my 2nd child, but this has been a lifesaver app. Really user friendly with an online backup that is easy enough to share with doctors. The partner app (calorie tracker) doesn't work and the food log has room for improvement, but otherwise a fantastic tool!

title: Great for my needs
body: GB, while it has many features, is wonderfully simple and easy for the feature I use: logging readings. The ability to email logs to my doctor as a cleanly formatted HTML table, with a single click, is fantastic. I have one suggestion here, though: allow me to mark rows of readings as sent so I know where to pick up from next time I send readings.

title: Awesome app
body: I was always forgetting my blood sugar log book when going to doctors. I found this one day and started using it right away.  When I went to the doctors to her surprise  I had my numbers for her. I showed her the app and she loved it and recommends it to the other patients.   This is a really big help for me.   Because I always have my phone with me.

title: Good, but HealthKit integration?
body: This is a good app for what it is. A few years ago I would have given it a 4. I bought the weight and BP add on and the multi-device sync. For a while the the sync service was not reliable, but that seems to e working again. I would really like for this to have health kit integration, but it has been years since this was updated. It works on iOS 8, but it has not been updated for the new screen sizes. I fear the developer has abandoned it.

title: Fantastic!
body: I've been a type 1 diabetic since 2012.  It is insanely difficult to keep a monitor of your blood sugars and find what could roughy be your range.  This app is fantastic in the fact that you can chart, graph and get your averages throughout the day.  In order to keep my blood sugars to acceptable, I treat this app as a game to see if I can keep making at goal.  Thank you Glucose Buddy!

title: Very handy and easy to use
body: I'm a newly diagnosed T2 diabetic and wanted some way to keep track of my BG without having to carry around a pen and a log book. This fit the bill really well. It would be extra useful to have a calendar feature that shows your readings in a calendar format so it'll be easier to show my doctor, as well as for me to visually see "oh that was my friend's wedding weekend and I ate like crap."

title: Really Assisted me in reducing A1C
body: I found that working actively with Glucose Buddy I was able to monitor, control and reduce my A1C significantly. I made good use of the average (under Profile) glucose logs and converting them to a probable A1C (through online Accu Check A1C Calculator) giving me incentive and hope. Glucose Buddy provided printouts of logs for my Internist, and Graphs illustrated my strengths and weaknesses, and eating patterns to share as well. Wonderful Tool!

title: Great App - Some suggestions
body: Great App - good approach with syncing and graphs.

title: A Step in the Wrong Direction
body: Version 3.0 is a step back from the prior version in useability and function. The loss of the graphing feature is huge. In addition, at least for me, the syncing feature of this version is not as reliable as the previous version (it seems as though the most current log entry dies not sync).  Also, can't seem to figure out how to delete a log entry. Overall not the best upgrade. Please bring back the reliabilty and functionality of the previous version.

title: Very Good App
body: I was using another App that was way to difficult to use for Type 2 needs! I like the way this App works! The comparison log is very useful and the input is a breeze!

title: Does what it says
body: This program has been a great asset in helping me control my blood sugar. It is easy to use and the graph helps with the visual look at how your blood sugar has been going. Being able to record medicine is a great added feature in the overall decision making on your control of your diabetes. Highly recommend.

title: Good program, spotty alerts
body: I have been using the program for a couple years. I love the idea, and until recently the execution. I rely on the alerts that are tied to an activity. 2 hours after I input a pre-meal activity it prompts me to check my numbers.

title: This would be good but one big problem.....
body: I bought this 4 days ago and registered on their website so I could sync with their website and get more detailed charts etc... however.... I can't do any of that becuase after 4 days they've never sent me the 'verification e-mail" that I have to link from to verify my e-mail address.  I can't log into their website and ask them, I"ve e-mailed them twice from the app itsself, but I've gotten absolutely no answer.  This looks like it would be a good app if it did what it says it can do, but so far, ZERO customer service and NO LOGINS!

title: Pretty good, but...
body: I like the app and is is functional but would be much better with just a few tweaks. First, it would be great if it was really integrated with CT. Secondly, another APP I used on my droid kept a running average of A1C, just based on glucose readings. Finally, I don't like that everything is jumbled together, such as glucose levels, medications, etc in the list. It makes it kind of hard to take a quick view.

title: Good application...
body: Looks good, so far it's working well... one thing I'd like to see is the ability to log A1C values and to graph them.

title: Glucose Buddy
body: I like the sync feature so in case of a crash the data is safe unlike dlife which I used to use but now avoid, since it lost all my data. The sync feature doesn't work hardly ever though and it's one way sync only.  I wish this app offered more graph features but it's still pretty good.

title: NO Updates since 2012!
body: This is a very good ap and easy to use and I wanted to upgrade to the Pro version but it concerns me that it's been so long since and upgrade was done and the reviews were not that encouraging along with your customer service. I just don't understand a company with a great product to not be concerned about these things.

title: WOW...what a great tool
body: This has really changed how I track and therefore manage my diabetes. I was having problems keeping my BG even below 300.  The tool has helped me lower my BG to by almost 150 points because of being able to manage most aspects of my diabetes in one place.  The graphs have been great for me since I'm very visual. I can't imagine not having Glucose Buddy!

title: diabetic
body: this was one of the first apps I got for my iphone everything works great except for one thing you can't input your glucose, medication, meal and exercise at the same time. this gets very tedious very fast. so much so that I now use a app that isn't as good as this one is in all other areas but, it let's me put all my information in at once. That one little thing is the reason this app won't work for me. it seems it wouldn't be that hard of a fix. until it happens I will be using the other app though

title: Great little program. Love the graphs and availability via website.
body: I really like how this app allows me to record my medication, then displays both medication and glucose readings on the same graph so I can see how it effects my levels. The ability to sync to the website so I can view it all on a bigger screen is also a really nice feature.

title: Fantastic easy to log and track
body: This is a fantastic app for those who have to keep track of your blood glucose levels. I highly recommend this free app with many options that can be customized for your individual needs. I am a type 2 diabetic and I am able to keep track of my progress through the free app.

title: Good start - needs more features
body: It seems hard to press buttons (dose, carbs, etc. Are covered by time of day and the mimetic keypad).

title: Great App for Diabetics
body: This app has been great for helping to track my glucose levels along with my weight, blood pressure and other important health numbers. It's great because I no longer have to worry if I forget to take my glucose logs to the Doctor it's all on my phone, and I can also sync it to my computer. Good job in this and it's user friendly.

title: Helping me stay in control
body: After being a type 1 diabetic for 11 years and having out of control numbers it finally clicked that I needed to make a change. This app has helped me to track my blood sugar numbers and I already feel better! Easy to use on the go and syncs very quickly!

title: Best glucose monitoring app!
body: Being diagnosed with diabetes 10 years ago I had to hand write my glucose levels down all the time. After using this app it just makes things so much easier to track my levels. I don't have to waste paper and I always have it on me. I have no excuse to forget to write my numbers down.

title: Just another DM software
body: There are many of these out there.  Great graphics but really a database which you have to enter all the data. For some reason I found this a pain to enter my BS or insulin dose when compared to what the meter does by itself.

title: Convenient Record Keeper
body: I really like Glucose Buddy because it captures all the information I need to monitor and manage my diabetes.  There is a place to record medications I take and my BG levels measured at various times a day.  I especially like the notes section where I can also note unusual circumstances and other health issues. Helps me and my doctor figure out how to maintain good BG levels more often!

title: Type 2 need a tool
body: Newly type 2 diabetic on pills right now and would like to keep track of when I take my medicine. All the application I have found are designed for insulin. Need the option to track pill intake to. Plus this application needs to be able to choose what stats to view on my info. I don't like tracking food because everything has to be entered separately.

title: Great App
body: This is a really good app for monitoring blood sugar levels. It is easy to use, reliable, and the connection with the web age is awesome. I like the reports you are able to print out. It is a very helpful app. The only thing I would suggest is a better food log/carb counter. And the ability to track ketones.  I tried other, more involved and expensive apps and this one just does the trick.

title: Great App!
body: I have been a type 1 diabetic for a loooong time. I was diagnosed before testing strips existed. This app is pretty amazing and keeps all of my info in one spot. I have always had a bunch of the little log books lying around and this makes things much easier. I would recommend this to anyone who needs to manage their diabetes.

title: Recommend
body: Good app - Not willing to upgrade.  Takes time getting personal meds and foods into the database.  Suggest getting an additional app to determine carb count other than the one suggested. Dissapointed that there is not an option to turn off the sync counter.  If this app had a better way to determine carbs and allowed the sync counter to be disabled i would give it a 5 star rating.

title: Really handy!
body: This is a great app for tracking glucose. I was able to enter old readings manually with no problem. It sorts corrections and keeps things in date order really well. I'm eager for an iPad version or at least for the iPhone version to support rotating but that's not a big deal. Bottom line it's a great app across many platforms.

title: Great app
body: This is a very easy to use way to keep track of glucose levels. I use this to Track for my gestational diabetes. It's easy for on the go use. It beats having to hand log in. On line sync lets you email to your dr. Office. This is a great app to have. I truly recommend it if you serious about monitoring and keeping up with you health.

title: Very helpful!
body: This app has really saved me. I have gestational diabetes & I'm at home on bed rest with twins after a month in the hospital. Keeping track of the numbers is a lot & this app is simple & easy to use. I love how I can see all my numbers on one screen & how easy it is to input numbers. I would definitely recommend it!

title: Great trending app for BG
body: I really only use this app as a way to keep track of my BG to pass on to my doctors. I do not really use too many of the other functions, yet. So far this has been easy to use and allows me to keep track of things I eat, insulin taken, and resulting BG through out the day. If the other functions work just as well, then I would bump the rating up to 5 stars.

title: A s avo
body: Really good app for managing my diabetes especially people who who have trouble writing I've found it easier to hit the buttons on my phone then write at times also nice to have blood sugars with me rite on my phone that's with me all the time in case I need to look back to track blood sugars unexpectedly also nice to sync when at Drs appts.

title: Back on track
body: I was diagnosed with pre-diabetes in 2008. Over the last few years I had become lax in checking my glucose. Last week, after checking my glucose, I saw that it was higher than it needed to be. This app keeps me accountable for my food choices throughout the day.  Easy to use and convenient

title: A really solid app!
body: I think this is a great app. My only suggestion would be to allow for food to be grouped into meals. Right now, you enter each food item as a separate entry which gets tiring. It would be great to create "lunch" entry with multiple items. That way, you could see the total carb count for that meal and see what you ate, all in one screen. Otherwise, I really like it.

title: This tool is great
body: TRY THIS APP FIRST! After using this tool for a week I must say it's more than I expected. Data entry is easy and log displays are clean. I had a sync problem but email support was quick and successful. I would like to see a category for blood pressure added in a future version. This version seem to run fine on iPhone OS 3.0.

title: Great. Works 4 me
body: I don' always test on the same meter. One in my purse, one in my desk, and one at home. I always have my phone handy so I can record my sugars and my Drs. and I review at a glance. I am also a kidney transplant patient and use it to record daily blood pressures. Since I see several specialists, I always have my numbers available.  I am probably not fully utilizing all the features, but it works for me.

title: Reliable
body: Glucose buddy helps me keep track of my blood sugar and meals. It makes it easier for my doctor to review daily readings. So far I think this is a wonderful app for anyone who is diabetic and forget to write their numbers down. Now all they need to do is push some buttons and save and they have an accurate record. Great, great app.

title: Wonderful app!
body: I really like this app.  Great for tracking and letting my doctor see the data and the graphs.  Love that I can sync it and keep the data for comparison purposes.  Thanks for a versitle and valuable tool!  I was using it on my iPod Touch and now use it on my iPad.  Wish there were some way to load the old data to my iPad though.

title: Transition made simple!
body: GB has definitely helped me to better organize my readings & plan for a healthier lifestyle. The email function is great! Being able to send an email if your history to yourself or even your Doctor is great. Being able to print out & view what I ate that spiked my sugar really makes this transition less stressful. I highly recommend GB. No problems so far with the app.

title: Great App!
body: I have Type 2 diabetes and have been using Glucose Buddy for well over two years now I've found it to be one of the easiest and best app for keeping track of variety of data points that my doctor wants me to track. I have tried many other free and paid apps and this is hands down the best.

title: Made my life easier!
body: This is my 2nd pregnancy managing my gestational diabetes with this app and it's been great!  I love being able to quickly enter my blood sugar level, when I checked, what part of the day it was (post-prandial, out of bed, etc), and the free space to make a little note to myself about what I ate or extenuating circumstances. Thank you!

title: Solid tracking program
body: I've enjoyed using this program for the last week. It is simple, intuitive and very capable for tracking blood glucose, food intake and medication. It allows you to customize your food and medication. I recommend this program for people of all ages.

title: Great free app!
body: This app has really helped me get my T1 diabetes back on track.  After a few uses I was familiar enough with the app to very quickly navigate and input my BS and insulin dosages. My biggest complaint is that the free version doesn't have a food/carb database. I have to input all the info myself, which is a hassle.  Despite this, I love this app, especially compared to others I've tried. :)

title: Good for tracking/managing.
body: I use this app daily. There have been lots of improvements and bug fixed since I started and it just keeps getting better. It has helped me track my blood sugar levels and manage my diabetes since diagnosis. The only gripe I have is that the charts it emails can be difficult to read for the doctors and nurses who need the info. Overall, great app.

title: Love This App!
body: I have been using the GB App for about two months. I love the automatic sync to the GB website. Since I have been using this app, I have yet to write a glucose test value down. My control is better and my Doctor really likes the print out that I take to him on check-up days. If you have Diabetes, this app is for you!

title: Helps keep track of glucose levels!
body: I like that I can keep track of my levels. My only negative for this app is that I can't send weekly glucose level to my doctor.  I would have to erase the old one in the email.  Tech support was quick to respond that they are working on it allowing us to pick dates to email our levels to our doctor/dietitian,etc.

title: Amazing space and time saver
body: This handy app saves the space a logbook, food diary, and info book and it has everything a well organized diabetic needs! It even gets all the detailed info that a log book doesn't have . My only issue is on the tool selection scroll it resets on the right side.

title: Highly recommend
body: As a medical professional I find this tool to be very efficient for the patient to monitor and record blood glucose levels. This app allows the patient and their providers an effective tool for diabetic control and delivering glucose levels in an easy to read manner while sharing data.

title: Great app!
body: This is a very good app! Been using it for a couple of years now. It's a simple and reliable way to keep track of my blood sugars. I even taught my Endocrinologist how to use it when I visit her. I used this app to email by BS when my doc was requesting them. Would recommend this app to anyone. Thanks for creating it. üòã

title: Syncing doesn‚Äôt work most of the time
body: I'm requesting that the app price of $6.99 be refunded. It would appear that the developers no longer support the app (based on multiple comments in the app forum) and, sadly, the app does not function properly. The primary problem - and the reason for paying for the pro version - is that syncing rarely works. When one attempts to sync, whether via the website or via the app, the repeated attempts tend to time out in most cases, making the $6.99 payment a complete waste of money.

title: No Support
body: I've tried contacting support several days ago-still no response, after paing for the App.  Problem has been I can't sync data up to the website.  It always tells me I haven't activated my account.  BUT, I can get into my account from the website - which presents another problem.  EVERYTIME I try to log in on the website I'm forced to reset my password.  It works, and my personal info is there, just not my BG readings.  When I log out I have to go through the process all over again of resetting my password.

title: Love love love
body: I love this app! It keeps me on track with my blood sugars and A1c. I show it to my doctor at every visit to help him make recommendations on medications. It is great to see the graph and averages too. I don't know how the paid version could be any better than the free version. Thank you for an app that actually makes my life easier!

title: Best app I've found
body: This is the best tracking app I've found. I don't put in detailed data about food or activity (yet) so I have not tried those functions. But for tracking sugar measurements, it works great. And I have not gotten the full version yet.

title: MUST HAVE!!
body: This is an amazing app! I've had diabetes for 19 years and have never been good at tracking my BGs or food entries but this puts it all at my finger tips and makes it very easy to send the data. I really like everything about the app and will inform my endocrinologist and CDE, and the Diabetes Center where I volunteer about the application. Thank you.

title: Why did I update!
body: Earlier version was much simpler, now I need an online account, now I need to sync my input readings with online account otherwise I have a numeral on the app icon like I get on iphone email app when I recieve new email, on the my info page use to be able to look at average BG over the length of time, not there anymore, instead of average you can input which meter you use. Come on now the earlier version was nice and simple and to the point, would gladly pay $5 - 10 for the earlier version if still available!

title: Brilliant
body: I have been looking for an application that truly helps me with keeping track of my blood sugar and this is it. I like all of the different options it allows for me to do especially the food and exercise. I especially like the fact I can email my doctor results as well as myself.

title: Easy to use
body: This seems to be a good app that allows you to easily manage/see your blood glucose readings. Thanks for making it free! I love it!! HORRIBLE integration with calorie tracker though. Just plain terrible on calorie tracker end as I can NOT get the suggested app to merge-it crashes. Why would they choose this app/company/kid that makes this??!? HELP!

title: Impressed Doctor!
body: My Medtronic CareLink failed when I installed Windows 7, but when I found Glucose Buddy, my problem was solved. All I have to do is put information in, email & print it and take it to my endocrinologist. He can then see how I am managing before each meal & bedtime & even before/after exercise. Thanks so much!!

title: Great Product!
body: I not only am a diabetic -- but I am also on dialysis. The program allows me to track my weight both before and after the treatment. These numbers are essential for me and my care team to watch my diet and fluid intake. With the log, I can track the progression both up and down. Great job!

title: Great but can be better
body: Rating for free version--no graph analysis if at goal with glucose, a1c, water intake, Bp,weight, bmi,cholesterol ;

title: Mrs. Mom
body: I've been diabetic for 25 years, so I've tried it all. This is a great app, except for the food. The food section really needs work. Who measures the amount of food they've eaten in grams?? There needs to be more choices for how the food eaten is measured. Even a place for putting carbs would be nice. I've just been putting my carb intake in the "notes" section and a "1" in the grams section. If they fix this problem it will be perfect!

title: Great app
body: I like the ease of tracking my sugar levels. One thing that would actually be a nice feature (and I would pay for this feature) is to be able to zoom in/customize look on the graph. I don't need to see an obscure view that goes up to 450 when I diet manage everything under 150.

title: IOS Update?
body: I keep getting a notification that this app will no longer work due to no update becoming available. I really like it and would hate to have to find another. There isn't a date that will happen but an update to prevent that would be great!!

title: Too good...
body: This program has been super helpful in controlling my diabetes. I've been using it for 3 months now, and I love it. There's not much of an easier way to keep track of how you are doing, especially with the charts, and the ability to email your doctor directly. Thanks!! (Cure coming soon!)

title: Very easy to use
body: This application is very easy to use. I had a few problems getting it to sync. I contacted the support team and my problem was solved in less than 20 mintues. I would recommend this app to anyone who want to keep a record of their diabeties. I really love using this, thanks for developing it. Donna Gaines

title: Great app!  I can't believe it's free!
body: I am a newly diagnosed diabetic and this app is the only thing that makes me feel as if I have some control over this disease. I love that I can download my data to the website.  Taking the data into Excel has made it much easier for me to look for patterns. Keep up the good work!

title: Very helpful
body: I am relatively newly diagnosed as diabetic, just starting out with keeping track of readings.  I looked at several related apps, and prefer this one.  I use only some of its features, but it has made record keeping simple, even enjoyable.  My doctor seems quite satisfied with the graphs I show her.

title: Exceptional
body: I started using this app upon switching from oral medications to insulin.  The program was intuitive, quick and reasonably easy to use.  I emailed both numerical data, comments, dose changes, and graphics to my Diabetologist, effecting easy recognition of trends, and markedly enhancing our ability to control the diabetes.

title: love the app
body: i second what everyone else is saying. and i love the reminder to check levels after eating. brilliant.  i did however have issues with the CT integration and never heard back from the support desk. my CT logs dont sync with the GB like its supposed to. and i wish there were ways to get more info on "how to's" within the app. but i love using this app. its oh so very helpful!

title: Easy to use
body: Just found out I have type 2 and GB has been a great help into this world of tracking blood sugar and other stats. It is user friendly and the sync feature has given my wife a way to follow everything without having to ask all the time.

title: Good Tool
body: I use Glucose Buddy every day. It really helps me keep track re how I am doing. I use the graphing feature to share my status with my doctor. Only problem I have run into is printing the graphs. It takes me several minutes of hacking around to get the printout I want. GB claims its not their fault. Don't know about that. I would pay extra to get good graph printing.

title: Easy to use!
body: Simple app to store and track blood sugar levels. Blood sugar meter syncs with computer already so I only use to keep records and quickly review past results. Will start using other features such as A1C tracking when I need to.  No technical issues so far!

title: Great free app
body: It tracks my daily readings and gives me a graph showing high, low, and average readings for the day.  The graph also has a green shaded area to show the normal range.  Everything else is a premium feature, however these basic features are what I needed.  The info is easy to enter and attractively presented.

title: The Best !!!
body: A complete glucose/medication/carb and exercise app with GREAT features. I love being able to add notes to each entry. My diabetic team loves the email feature. Although don't bother with calorie track, GoMeals is so much easier to use and has a much better database. When will GB be able to sync with the new Fitness Buddy!?!

title: Very useful
body: This product is proved a godsend for me in managing my diabetes as I often test with multiple meters depending on where I am at a given time. this works very well to enable me to have one single repository of everything and be able to bring it to the doctor and show him the numbers and a graph.

title: LOVE IT!
body: I've used Glucose Buddy for 3 yrs to log my blood glucose readings. Easy to use. Great to print readings for docs. As a glucose tracker, Glucose Buddy, is great... and I've tried many others. Only 4 stars cause trying to integrate with their calorie counting program, Calorie Track, is impossible; it crashes every time. Calorie Track is a waste. Use Livestrong's My Daily Plate instead for calorie tracking. It's excellent.

title: Glucose Buddy Works to Save My Life.
body: Without Glucose Buddy I would not be able to track my b/s. I can see what is and has happened, all times. I can plan what I need to do to control my disease.  My doctor can easily see what is happening with me and prescribe what need to do in the future. I have to say ,Glucose Buddy  is my best friend.

title: Great!
body: I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes, and this app really helps keep me in track. Like others have said, I wish it would sync with Myfitness Pal. Also, I wish there was a way to email specific parts of your log to your provider, instead of the whole thing every time. Otherwise, fantastic app....especially for being free!!!

title: Pretty good
body: I really like this app. I've had Type 1 Diabetes fr nearly four years now and I used to hate my doctor telling me that I have to write down numbers so I never did x). but now it's easy!

title: Very useful
body: Love the ease of entry, the graphs, & the ability to send a clear, easy to read email to my daughters doctor. They only thing I haven't figured out is how to add the carbs. It only seems to allow the grams. I would like to see how the amount and type of carbs affects her bg. This is not to say the app doesn't do that, just that I haven't figured it out yet.

title: Nice Tool
body: This is a nice tool that is easy to use as well as being handy. I was ably to enter all my data from my paper journal. I wish I could graph my weight along with my glucose levels.  However, I am able to include my daily weight as a comment so my paper journal is no longer required.

title: Azumio geniues
body: I am type 2 diabetic with the help of this app I was able to get my a1c down from 13 to 6.6 in a little over 1 month! I am a nurse and have had several of my PTA , Doctors & fellow nurses download this app and teach their PTA how to use it! I love the graph and I upload my bs to my chart at my des once a month! Genius!!! 10*********

title: Get this now!
body: This app is a necessity for anyone recently diagnosed. Instead of writing and carrying that log book everywhere you can use your phone. It shows you highs lows and I use to show my doctor my numbers. It is easy to use convenient and you can save your info.

title: A Great App for Your Life with Diabetes
body: I am so greatful for this app! I was just diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes and am still trying to find my footing a bit. This app has made tracking my pertinent medical information so much easier! I would recommend it to EVERYONE who needs to track their sugar and food information!

title: A must for all diabetics
body: This AP is a must for any diabetic of any type. I have Type 2 diabetes and the graph alone helps me keep track on how my levels are doing. Great for my doctor as well who doesn't have to bring up every day one at a time on my meter. With this AP everything is right there!

title: Most Excellent
body: Keeping notes is good but with this app on my phone it's always at my fingertips!  By faithfully entering my readings I was able to see the graph and make better sense of my levels.

title: For simple tasks.
body: I am just using it as a log and graphing tool. That part works well. Some of the other features don't appeal to me. Setting notification reminders is broken for some parts and it won't remember my meter type. The fix is to create an account which really shouldn't be required or it should say as such.

title: Pretty good
body: Helps me keep track better than with a separate paper recorder. Wish there were built in food options with info and wish I had choices other than grams to record my intake. Would be nice if there were push reminders for testing (eg after a meal was recorded) or to take meds. Would also be nice to be able to set "high" and "low" according to my doctors recommendation.

title: Easier Glucose Log
