title: Ophthalmologist. Edward Thomas MD
body: GgffantasticgreatTiger

title: Very helpful app
body: I‚Äôm new to the whole diabetes game as I didn‚Äôt even know I was until a stroke 10/2020. Now I am scrambling to learn how to change everything to live with it.  This app has been wonderful for a place to track and compare BG readings and track A1C.  Would highly recommend this app for getting to know your diabetes through tracking readings and the tutorials.

title: Where is customer service??
body: Cannot find a way anywhere in the app to contact customer service. I want to know why I was charged $54 for a $39.99 annual subscription. That‚Äôs a $14 difference.

title: Constantly trying to get you to upgrade
body: I started out using the free version and you could only get a graph of your glucose for that day. In order to see a week you had to upgrade to $29.99. No I just learned if you want to see a month worth of data you must once again you guessed it upgraded to $79.99. So now you are paying $109.98 for an app.

title: Suggestions
body: I really like the app but a few suggestions. Count the total carbs of the different food items added. And fix the bug that now generates a separate item when scanning a bar code instead of including it in the meal entry I am making.

title: Can‚Äôt contact, can‚Äôt fix date
body: Has info I never put in, today‚Äôs date is 5/13/2020, entered today‚Äôs info date shows Dec 1969 I‚Äôll get another

title: Awful
body: How do I cancel? There is no link to the billing portion of this and it is certainly not worth 39.99! Hopefully someone responds as the ‚Äúapp support ‚Äú link doesn‚Äôt work

title: Great App but Sketchy Subscription/Customer Service
body: I got glucose buddy back in February around when I got diagnosed. The free features were great and eventually I decided to try a free week of their $29.99 subscription as I wanted to do better. The counselor I worked with (Liz) was great and very informative and the lessons I got to read the first week were helpful, at the end I agree to start the subscription and stupidly gave my card info (important), I did not pay through the Apple store. Once I was signed up I still had my counselor, but all of the added features were gone. Honestly I didn‚Äôt really think of it right away, but eventually I mentioned it to my counselor and it supposedly got fixed, I wasn‚Äôt sure what all the added features were so I can‚Äôt say everything was correct. Thanks to Covid and my work hours being cut I had to drop all extra bills. I contacted my counselor as I couldn‚Äôt find any customer support, contact info, or how to cancel a monthly subscription. She gave me the companies customer support e-mail and I contacted them. I was told they couldn‚Äôt do anything. It was a subscription through Apple, but it wasn‚Äôt....there is no record of it through Apple (except for the fact I downloaded the app through the App Store), and my bank was always charged directly by the Azumio company. Any subscription I have gotten through Apple were always billed to Apple, not the individual companies. Customer service kept saying only Apple could fix it..... but Apple can‚Äôt as it wasn‚Äôt through them!!!! In the end I had to go to my bank. Which is a shame as had they not pulled all this bs I would have re-subscribed when I could. The App features are good if you choose to get this app, but use with caution!

title: Latest update causes instant crash
body: I can‚Äôt use the Glucose Buddy app anymore, even though I am a premium member. It crashes every time I use it after the update that was pushed out on 7/9/2020. Please fix.

title: 7 Day Free Trial- Not
body: Hi! I agreed to a 7 day free trial and then $59.99 yearly. I was charged right away. What happened to my free trial? Also $71.99 came out of my account not $59.99. Something is seriously wrong.

title: I wish I could have picked 0 stars.
body: Not user friendly at all. I paid for the subscription for the year (39.99) and after about a week I was so frustrated and really wondered why they charge anything for this worthless app. When I tried to cancel I had to go through Apple, I never heard anything back from my first request and now when I try to dispute it through resolution center it says non-refundable. Do not waste your money on this

title: Says nothing re $39.99 subscription charge.

body: My A1-C has drop to 6 after using Jardiance. I have lost 13 pounds. My blood pressure is 120/70. My sugar is between 70 and 110. I feel great.

title: Newest update renders app useless
body: Newest update renders app useless. Why get rid of sugar graph bars that line up with daily exercise. Spent an entire $39.99 and app still falls short of previous revs. I‚Äôm moving to another app

title: Charging now for what was free

title: Papapuka
body: I have found Glucose Buddy to be a great app for keeping track of my glucose readings 24/7/365.

title: A true life saver AND time saver!!
body: This app is excellent for all types of diabetics. It has an exceptional system for documenting meals, meds taken, and blood glucose levels. I am NOT tech savvy and I have been able to easily navigate this app. Within 3 days of using it I upgraded- it was worth every cent. There is even an A1C ‚Äúpredictor‚Äù as to what u might expect on your bloodwork.... I will have to come back in 2 months to let you know how close it was! Easy bar code scanning feature to document foods. Easy to document what you eat. A true life & time saver for me.

title: Terrible update
body: Just can‚Äôt figure out this latest update. Prior to this last update I had no problem entering my glucose reading, meds with strength taken and foods I ate and saving same. This latest update make no sense to me so guess it‚Äôs goodbye Glucose Buddy

title: Quirky and limited customer support.
body: This app is useable, but a bit quirky. It has limited customer support in the form of a brief FAQ and limited knowledge base.

title: Love this!
body: Very useful app! Great forum too! Wonderful developers. Try it out!!!

title: Works very well
body: This app works well but, needs improvement.  I agree with a previous reviewer, it would be nice if it worked in landscape view. I also find it irksome that it reverts back to "Out of Bed" catagory after a input, especialy when one is going to use the same catagory for a second entry.  Still its worth the mony not paid.

title: Well done
body: Just started the journey of Type 1 with our 9 year old daughter. This has been a great app to log glucose, meds, activity, and Food intake. There is no built in food database, you add your own items. We just added a carbs entry to track total carbs. The in app graph for BG is helpful and entering logs is quick. The sync to the web is one of the strong suits. And the new 2 way sync, while a 19.99 add-on for a year, is keeping 3 iOS devices in our family in sync. One way sync is still free. Checking your data online yields more graphs and CSV export. Capturing the in app graph and emailing logs is also straightforward. My 9 year old has learned it quickly and enters logs on her iPod which sync with the premium feature to my and my wife's iPhones over the air. Developer responsive on forum and Facebook, you can tell this is a personal passion. Updates come regularly so I look forward to improvements. Free app with premium add-ons is a good model.

title: Multi-device sync is a good idea with a bad price
body: I've been a Type 1 for 24 years and was happy to find this app.  I was looking forward to the multi device capability being added to Glucose Buddy and was VERY disappointed with the $19.99 a year charge for the multi device sync. I wouldn't mind paying $5 to $10 for the ability to use the app on my iPhone and iPad but it's just not worth the nearly $20 a year. The app itself is pretty good. It would be nice to have better carb tracking abilities. I just use Lose It for that. I won't be adding the new upgrade to my iPhone.

title: Ability to enter earlier blood sugars
body: The app is ok but it is annoying that you cannot enter earlier tests. Some time I have forgotten to enter my blood sugar from earlier in the day and I can't enter so then I cannot send accurate info to my dr.

title: I've dramatically reduced my insulin requirements
body: This has been important in tracking my progress with managing my diabetes.  Due to Tim Ferriss' "The Four Hour Body" and Glucose Buddy, I went from taking insulin needles 4 times a day to zero (0) needles!  This was in about 6 weeks!

title: Works well, easy to use
body: I don't use a lot of the features.  It works well for keeping a journal of my blood sugar. I am hoping to be able to print out a three month report for the doctor.

title: No good since update

title: Worst ever

When you paid for the one year it then let‚Äôs you know that it will be recurring. I have never written a review like this before and if I can‚Äôt get better information before I purchase another app for diabetes then I won‚Äôt buy it.

body: I use this daily and present the log to my doctor. Before this app was available I was using an Excel spreadsheet.  How much more simpler this app is. I love it!!

title: Solid app, and free, too
body: Very simple and useful app. Putting glucose readings into a simple graph should help all diabetics easily spot trends in their glucose readings. It will also help new patients who are trying to understand the mechanics of being a diabetic. Far, far better than the little paper diaries we all started with.

title: Great app.
body: Really helps me track my blood sugar and keep track pf when I exercise. I also really like it's A1C estimator. My doctor is always surprised at how close it is. I so miss one of the early features though. It seems I can't erase the graph and start fresh again after my doctor visits.

title: Great Diabetes App
body: This is a great app. It is even better now that you can sync multiple devices. I use it on my iPhone, iPad and computer and they are all in sync. It tracks everything you need and generates reports you can send or give to your doctors.

title: Great ap

title: Excellent Tool
body: I have always struggled to keep logs of my blood sugar readings.  My son added this to my new iPad in September and in the past six months I have only missed two readings where I was out of strips.  The improvements in my record keeping and the related better understanding of my disease not only made this app useful, but my  purchase of the iPad worthwhile.

title: The Best

title: Great app!
body: I started using this app right after I got my iPhone. I tried another app before finding this one, and it didn't compare with how easy this is to use. The only thing I wish it had is an A1C calculation. It keeps track of the average BG for you, so it seems like it would be pretty easy to add that feature. When I shared this information with my Dr., he decided to get an iPhone! I really find this app a great way to keep my records up to date!

title: Gestational diabetic's best friend
body: This app was so awesome!  I loved that I could print my reports for doctors visits (which were weekly) instead of having to write everything out.  The graph was really handy as well!

title: Right on target
body: I have used this for over a year. During the last year, I have lost over 60 pounds and now have my A1C to 5.7. Glucose Buddy  has played a major factor. I m able to track my mess and intake and share it with my doctor. Thank you Glucose Buddy for my better health

title: It's in the numbers
body: Solid app for recording and reviewing BG and medication along with notes. It os also good to see the trend via the graph. The performance has suffered a little in the latest version (3.6) but it is a useful and handy app that is easy to use. My doctor wanted the name.

title: Excellent app
body: This app has helped me lower my blood glucose. I am very pleased with it and highly recommend Glucose Buddy.

title: Cjk0101
body: Does not count carbs

title: Ok, for a free app...
body: This app is ok for tracking glucose levels, but it really doesn't do anything else. The fact that you can set up an account online is nice, but the features of the app are rather limited. The graph of glucose level is useful but the scale is way too wide (0-460 mg/dL??? Really???). And there isn't an option to change the time frame either... In summary, it's probably better to pay $3 for another app with more options or functions...

title: Need a Notes field
body: I love the app but it could be greatly improved with a text field to add notes about the circumstances or food item. Thanks

title: Never been so happy with an app
body: I can honestly say I have never been so happy with an app before. Great tools and organization. The only change I'd ask for is to make it possible to organize the log with folders for each day. The big long list can be hard to sort through. But still this app is crazy awesome!!!

title: Good
body: Good app for recording and viewing blood sugars. I would think it would be wonderful if you could have a sync with the pump and meter like the meters can with pumps. This would make it much easier to accurately record your sugars.

title: Glucose Buddy is no Friend
body: As a diabetic and iPhone user I had hoped this app would solve my problem of manually having to record blood glucose and insulin data.  Sad to report this product doesn't deliver as promised.  Had problem with logs being accurate.  Also customer service experience was the worse.  Explained problem twice and could get them to understand the issue.  Also, bought some add-on for $3.99, which I thought allowed me to access web-site and exchange data to iPhone and iPad....was told that feature is $14.99.  When asked what the $3.99 charge was for...the customer support guy, Tom, said he didn't know. I've deleted the app and I'm $3.99 wiser.

title: Very helpful app
body: I use this app daily to track my glucose readings. I really like the graph. That gives a quick visual of how I'm doing. Without this I would do a poor job of tracking I'm sure. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is there's currently no ability to sync to another device for backup or to move your history to a new phone. Maybe that will be in an upcoming release.

title: Nice app
body: This works great. Having the data in the cloud is a big plus.

title: Great app
body: Love it!

title: Great application could use extra features
body: I have used it since the first day my daughter was diagnosed. It's very helpful and easy to use. I would love to see and insulin calculator( CF + I:cho) included in here. I have to go back and forward in between glucose buddy and other application. Another great addition would be a database with food carb information.

title: Helps a bunch
body: This app is really working to keep me on track.  Love it.

I‚Äôd also like to see more add-ons available for purchase so I can track the other things I have to track.  (temperature, FEV1, FVC, and FVE25-75; in case anybody at Asumio is listening).

title: "can't establish connection to server"
body: Lately, the app is very unstable. It will not sync back to my PC half the time, making it very difficult to print my logs prior to my next MD appt... Borders on useless if this continues.

body: Problem with sync they keep asking me need to register and wrong username and password. I emailed to customer service  3 times and I still have not heard from them

title: Awesome

title: Among my most used application.
body: They fixed the problem with syncing and timeouts with their servers.

title: Good app, but lacks food support
body: Newly diagnosed Type 2, have been using the free version of the app for a week. I like the ease of logging blood glucose. I also like the method of the account data with the sync to the web app, which makes the data available on the computer instantly, instead of sitting on the Apple device until the Excel data is exported like other apps I tried.  It can be used for several types of logs, which is nice. Unfortunately, logging food isn't as friendly as I'd like. Missing bar code scanning and other features that could make it more useful.

title: App user
body: Works great and easy to log . I like that it syncs to a web site . I send this right to my doctor. I have only used the blood sugar part of this app.

title: Update
body: This app needs to be updated for compatibility. I continue getting pop ups from apple saying so. It's slowing things down on my iPhone. I hope the developer will pay attention, as they never have before. They take your money then leave you hanging.

title: Don't won't your suger!
body: I use this app daily and love it.it give me a better view of what my body responds to

title: No support
body: On surface looks good.  No support.  Telephone number is not connected.  I need to print charts for my Doctor, but can sync from my Iphone to the Web site.  Continues to say my password or username is not correct.  Emailed support three times no answer.  If any one is out there would appreciate some help. With out the ability to syn and print  from their online site the App is useless for me. The error may be mine but if support would contact me it might be possible to clear it up.

title: Helps
body: This has helped me keep up and able to show my Dr.when I see her

title: Great app!
body: Great app for allowing me to track so many things at one time and be able to show to my MD.  I use the app daily.

title: Life saver
body: I was being a bad T-2 diabetic. Having this app gives me an easy way to track my BG and share the data with my MD.  The forums section has some inspiring stories about why you want to be a "good" diabetic.

title: Great chart for MD
body: I proudly present my readings history to my physician with GB. The only reason not to give it 5 stars is that too often the syncing fails because the server is down. But you lose no readings as the next time you try, it uploads two.

title: Glucose Buddy
body: This app is amazing. I can keep track, on my phone, all of my blood sugars and it will give me a breakdown of my A1C and I can print it to bring to my MD for my appointments.

title: MD
body: The best app for keeping track of my own diabetes control. I'm so taken with it that it has become my standard advisory app for all my patients with diabetes; and they love it. Oh, by the way, I'm not being paid for this endorsement.

title: Good App, expensive add-ons
body: This is the best app I've found for monitoring my glucose.  It's just a shame they really rip you to add a simple blood pressure measurement ($3.99) and the cost for basic multi-device sync at @12.99 is absolute piracy!

title: Great App, not updated in long time
body: Best glucose tracking app out there. Docked one star because it hasn't been updated for iphone 5/5s or iOS 7.

title: Majorsticks0937
body: This is a very useful app.  Makes my life easier.  Keeping my MD informed of my blood sugars is a major benefit.

title: User
body: Easy to use.It works good for a record that my doctor can review. Thanks

title: Seems pretty good so far
body: I read reviews of many diabetic logging apps and felt this was one of the best two or three. Downloaded and have been trying it out for a couple of days. After in-app purchase of the two-way sync service ($12.99/year!!!) I experienced some challenges getting it to sync in both directions but finally found the button to "Sync All Logs" in the Settings panel.

title: Glucose buddy is a real Buddy
body: Well with me it is so awsome! I have my phone at hand all the time, I don't always have a pin or my log book. I really love the buddy for logs and I can send it to my Doctor too . This is a really big help because I get really absent minded and It helps me keep organIzed ! Thanks so much. One thing I would add is, the ability to save notes without a glucose test . It's not possible at this time. Sometimes I get caught working away from my meter and am unable to test at that moment and would like to note it. But other than that I love this app. If not for the app, I'm really a bad log keeper.

title: The Add-Ons offered areSomewhat deceptive...
body: I have had this app for awhile, but I used another (now gone from the store) because I liked their interface better.  I had to go to Glucose Buddy; and I saw that it offered syncing to their website with an add-on for $399.  Well, the add-on they offer does NOT sync back and forth, ONLY TO THEIR WEBSITE.  They want $12.99 per year for an add-on they describe as designed for syncing between several devices; which I was not doing.

title: New to diabetes
body: Although I am not new to diabetes because my parents are both diabetic. But me personally, I am new to diabetes. The glucose buddy has helped me tremendously. I was diagnosed with metabolic syndrome. And glucose buddy has made it pretty simple to record everything. Food, blood sugar, I even put my blood pressure in the notes. I always have my glucometer with me, as well as my iPhone, so it's pretty easy for me to keep track. The emailing of charts is simple. I can send it to my wife, doctors, parents, anyone really. This program has made this transition easy for me. Thank you.

title: Where's the graph/chart????
body: This application is the best one I have ever used to track my diabetes. I used to have a pocket pc and the expensive program "Sinovio" diabetes application. This one beats it hands down. HOWEVER, v2.1 was better because of the graph. Now, if you could put the graphics/chart back into v3.0, you'd have the best on the market, even if cost $50.00, and that's no bull!! Please put it back in.

title: A terrific idea, but a bit clunky
body: I like the idea of being able to send my data to my doctor, but when I tried to set up the necessary Glucose Buddy account, I discovered that my username already had been taken. This almost certainly means I had created an account months ago and forgotten about it. But there is no "forgot password?" button, so I am left with probably two accounts, one a phantom and the other the one I now intend to use. This is my fault of course, but I'll bet it is a common occurrence, particularly for folks in the sixties (like me) who are the most likely customers of this product. I have used the second account, for the reason that I am unlikely to remember a distinctive user name that departs from the one I am accustomed to using. So for now, the application is of little use to me. These folks should follow the lead of nearly every other account-based system, and create a mechanism for absent minded customers to recover (and change) their password.

title: Great app but needs e-mail
body: This is a great little app that has improved over the last couple years. I'm upping my rating but still not 5 stars.  A way to e-mail the log, or just a certain set of days, to my MD would be great. Will you please add this function?

title: Glucose buddy
body: This easy to use app makes it easy to log numbers, write notes, graph and forward results to a MD. Can't figure how to view entered foods and activities. I have not bought the supplemental app.

title: Very useful app.
body: This is a great way to track my blood sugar readings and medications. The email function is useful in that I can send it to my doctor when needed and forward a copy to my online medical alert database so it is available in an emergency. Very fast and helful support when I had email trouble with app + very willing to listen to my suggestions

title: This app has made being on top of my diabetes a snap!
body: I have to say that this app brightened my world.

title: buyer‚Äôs beware!
body: This is a buyer‚Äôs beware:  if you buy this app be prepare to pay more money than you thought.  I tried Glucose Buddy, and thought it to be adequate for what I need, so I bought it $3.99.  After I bought it, I find out that you have to pay even more if you want the advertisements removed $3.99, and if you want a two way communication with your online backup it‚Äôs another $12.99 per year.  They call these extra add-ons, which all other apps come with as part of the full version.

title: Great
body: Easy to keep track of my sugar
